Content: I do some yoga so I‚Äôm ok with these workouts. Only problem is some are tough on my knees. During the assessment it asked if you have sensitive knees, and I said yes. But there are still some floor moves that have me rock back and forth on my knees. Only problem I‚Äôve had so far. Also can‚Äôt put my real name here cuz it says it‚Äôs taken. So that‚Äôs weird too.
Title: So far so good

Content: Very organized and easy to use app. I‚Äôm using it for establishing healthy eating habits vs. weight loss, but it‚Äôs a great reminder on either of those issues. I recommend you give this app a try. I‚Äôm pretty critical about apps but this one is well worth utilizing!
Title: Better than expected!

Content: Really like this program. I only have one complaint.  The word next right in front of the model, cannot see her position of her hands, feet, etc.  till the timer starts. Title: Feedback

Content: Before you start using the services of this app, you should know that the customer service here is terrible. More specifically, there is none here. I had a lot of questions and misunderstandings, but there was no one to help me with them. The support team was either very long or not very clear. In any case, it was hard to get help. Also, I noticed that when I had an inconvenient question, they might not even answer. Do you still want to use these?
Title: Poor employee attitude

Content: First this app was accidentally purchased, as soon as I realized this i contacted the company to please ask for a refund due to it was not my intention to use this app.  They canceled my subscription after my month was over. I decided to go and just it a try.  Logging your food tends to be difficult, when you type in your food description it shows you everything but what your searching. Also all my info that I did log got wiped out.   Everything is extra. I reached out a second time and am yet awaiting a response.
Title: Not worth it

Content: I am very confused at what this actually costs and I can‚Äôt figure out how to cancel it. I was charged $42 because my 7 day trial was up. Is that $42 a month or is that for the next six months? I was under the impression it was $10 a month? Can someone please tell me what I am paying for and how I can unsubscribe if I decide to, thanks!
Title: Cost

Content: After buying a discounted plan of $20 on the Better Me website, I found that the app is not at all what I had hoped and expected. I bought the app in hopes of it to be helpful in losing weight for a wedding I will be in, in May.   As soon as I paid for the app and the program I was bombarded with ads and things popping up all over my screen trying to get me to spend more money and that, to me, in unacceptable. The app is not very helpful and is a waste of time and money, in my opinion.
Title: Waste of Time and Money

Content: So I was charged $9.99 for a weekly subscription. I had no idea it was one week that I was purchasing but my fault for not reading the fine print. Then a week later I‚Äôm billed another $9.99 for a full month subscription. Who does business like this? What a fricken rip off!! Update: I changed my rating to 3 stars because was Better Me refunded the subsequent $9.99 I was charged. I appreciate the quick resolution to my issue.
Title: Scam alert. Updated

Content: Each workout pose should give users end signal. People usually not looking at the screen but the app changes the pose to another without any sound signal. How people know the pose has been changed? I think the app developers seem not test out by themselves.  Also the graph should be more accessible. Users just keep recording daily activities but the progress can‚Äôt be easily found.
Title: Need improvement

Content: It seems like a great app so far! I love that it gives you a LOT of meal options and the work outs are well personalized. I wish it had an option of limitations or something. I don‚Äôt have weights (am not in the place to get any), have arthritis and a cyst my one of my joints so it would he helpful to have more customizing on my end to be able to work around my condition.
Title: Mostly good

Content: I do like this app! But if there was one thing I could possibly add, it would be to have a few second intervals between workouts to get ready for the workout that is up next. Such as the plank challenge workout. Have maybe 5-10 seconds for switching positions before going into them. Just a suggestion. But otherwise, I like it!
Title: Workout intervals

Content: Horrible. Just Horrible. You get one day of the calorie tracker then it's just a workout app and you can't use it well unless you get the un reasonably expensive premium. If you sign up for notifications even WORSE. Even if you want to loose a pound or two after a long weekend of unhealthy food or whatever even the smallest amount of weight loss they will send you a notification stating "we are worried about your weight loss goals" trying to be sympathetic but it just makes you feel fat and ugly and horrible the way they say it. TERRIBLE APP!!!!!
Title: Horrible.

Content: I had started in this app a few months ago and I loved it, it was perfect for me and I had gone through half of my workout goal and then today I open the app after updating and all my progress is gone and I have to start completely over. The formatting is all different and how they set up the work outs is completely different. I feel like they stole my money and took away the one thing I enjoyed doing for me every night. Super disappointing and I‚Äôm going to work with the App Store to get my money back.

But it‚Äôs like a month or two later and they are still taking my money. So unless you want to be robbed of your money even after you are done with the app, I wouldn‚Äôt suggest getting it.

Content: So I downloaded this app and started my free trial, I soon later found another app that‚Äôs free so I wanted to cancel my subscription from the ‚Äòbetter me‚Äô app. At the moment I guess there was a problem with the app Bc I was clicking to unsubscribe but it wasn‚Äôt letting me. Content: Making this experience personal in these articles will help I believe when negative thoughts come. These articles give a plan before issues come up which could cause resistance to doing the best and right thing. Thanks so much.

Title: perfect workout app

Content: The recipes are worthless. Title: Recipes written in grams

I do like the choices of exercises that I can do at home whenever I want- even while watching TV.
Title: BetterMe app

Content: Well, I just got the app yesterday and I‚Äôm trying to use it today but it doesn‚Äôt work properly. Every time you press the work out it just spins doesn‚Äôt go to the next work out. I have to close the app out and open it back up. It‚Äôs quite frustrating. I wanted it to work and the app is just not working. Don‚Äôt spend your money on it if you don‚Äôt have to because I know I won‚Äôt get my money back
Title: I wanted to love!

Content: This app not only tracks calories, but includes exercise, water, and mental health too. I‚Äôm just getting started, and am excited to see the results. I enjoy the reminders it sends to drink my water or eat a meal. I am older, and this  has been very helpful to me.
Title: Great way to a better life

Content: I am somehow locked out of my account and cannot access my plan.  Reset password feature says that I do not have an account.  But my Apple subscription says I will be billed soon. Clicking the button to start a new account looks like it will start me from scratch with a brand new plan.  Requests to the support email team have gone unanswered.   I am leaving this review hoping that I will receive a response and be able to actually use this app.
Title: Can‚Äôt access my plan

Content: I signed up for an annual subscription, but have been charged $50 per month since January!! When I called to sort out the charges and ask for a refund they said it was what I signed up for.  So no refund, but they‚Äôve said they will now cancel, with another round of charges through 4/15. I NEVER would have agreed to pay more than $600 for a yr of this app. Buyer beware, the user flow for signing up is confusing and at the very least unclear, seemingly intentionally so.
Title: Beware: Deceptive Subscription Plan

Content: The reason I put 3 stars is everything looks amazing and good but you have to pay; I understand why but it‚Äôs an excessive amount! I could get a gym membership for cheaper amount and a free meal plan.   Plus, this says 12+ and Im older than 12 and when I put in my age, it did not accept ( minority of teens do not have debit cards able to pay- that‚Äôs why they come for free apps )
Title: My 3 Star Review

Content: ‚Ä¶I‚Äôve had the app for a few weeks and it has some great things, but it‚Äôs hard to track food. There‚Äôs no option for ounces. The recipes are from cooks out of the US and that makes it hard to follow the translations. Exercise videos have been good. I‚Äôll come back after my 3 months and up date this. Look for a deal before you commit.
Title: Not too bad

Content: This app helps me keep accountable and is very easy to follow. I‚Äôm able to see progress through graphs which helps me visualize what I need to improve on for future days. I am so happy with this app and am seeing progress already! I‚Äôve only been doing this a week!
Title: The only thing that‚Äôs worked for me!

Content: I have sent 3 emails trying to the support team and none have been responded to and have given much more time then the 8 hours or less response time. The feature that says cancel subscription on the app directs you to message someone from the support team. I have written two messages on the app that appear to be ‚Äúunavailable‚Äù and deletes them. I have not been able to get in touch with anyone from the app and am very disappointed. I still am hoping to hear from someone.
Title: Unable to cancel subscription

Content: I paid for a year subscription, then clicked cancel renew so I wouldn‚Äôt forget in a year to cancel. As soon as I clicked cancel subscription, Apple let me know that I still had access for one year since I did pay for it. However, once I went back into the app to start using it, it said subscription expired, despite money being taken out for a year membership, and wouldn‚Äôt let me click restore purchase or go into the app. I couldn‚Äôt get past the screen forcing me to make a purchase (that I already made).

Content: The app is very helpful to lose weight, started with 144 pounds and helped me to reach 137. Only thing can you add some kind of voice command during the exercises? Or a sound notification when it‚Äôs time to change exercise? It‚Äôs frustrating to have to keep the eyes on the screen to see when it‚Äôs time to change exercise. Thx

Content: I love this app so much but can you make a weight lifting app for women but otherwise I recommend this to everyone and they should use this app but it‚Äôs a bit expensive and it‚Äôs a struggle but you should check out the other BetterMe apps I got all of them except BetterMen because well I‚Äôm not a guy

Content: This app is a scam only used the app a few times and it automatically added me to its subscription taking money out of my account for MONTHS now. Canceled the subscription so many times and don‚Äôt even have the app downloaded for a while now and they are still charging me. Over all the past months they‚Äôve taken over $600. Even during a pandemic barley having money to live off of since I‚Äôm no longer working, I‚Äôm still getting charged and taken money out even though I‚Äôve unsubscribed countless times. THIS APP IS A SCAM SAVE YOURSELF TIME AND MONEY
Title: SCAM THEYLL STEAL YOUR MONEY

Content: This app has good workouts and tracking system for tracking your steps, however it does not have a very wide variety of foods to choose from to log. Even when scanning the barcode of simple things,  the system can‚Äôt find them and it doesn‚Äôt seem to have very many options to pick from.

Content: Overall the app is clean, and works amazingly!  I only wish that the meal plans could export a shopping list. It‚Äôs hard to go through every single meal and make sure you have every single thing for the week. You could select the days and export a shopping list of the ingredients.
Title: Great App, but...

Content: The subscription selection screen is grossly misleading on this app. They tell you you can pay $2.75 weekly or $29 monthly, so I selected the weekly option. However, they make is grotesquely unclear that they are going to, in fact, bill you $119 in one lump sum. I contacted the developer twice via the ‚Äúcontact us‚Äù (LOL) page on their website AND I sent them a DM on their social media pages requesting a refund and  I GOT ZERO RESPONSE. This subscription selection method is broken and a scam looking to rip people off. (PLUS YOU CAN FIND ALL THESE WORKOUTS FOR FREE ONLINE. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND JUST USE GOOGLE/YOUTUBE)
Title: Subscription SCAM

Content: There was no where on this app to cancel the subscription and I thought only way to cancel is to delete the app since there no feature to cancel. You guys went ahead and subtract subscription when I delete the app off my phone to try to figure out how to cancel it.

Content: I downloaded this app to try it out, within the 7-day free trail I tried to cancel my subscription before getting charged. It was impossible, the app gives zero information on how to do that. I sent them an email to seek help and I did not receive any answer. If they are planning on doing business with their customers, they better deliver a good service. Would NOT recommend this app at all, it is not something out of the ordinary. You can find all the workout ideas on Instagram and for FREE!

Content: I‚Äôve always wanted to work out. Before I would mainly go to the gym but I would not be motivated to drive all the way to the gym and go back home. This app is a game changer. Never thought I could burn as much calories as I did at the gym all the way from my house.

Content: so i do really really LOVE this app, but i don‚Äôt like the food option. i wish this app did something along the lines of a ‚ÄúPersonal Preference Quiz‚Äù to know your like and dislikes.. i do believe 10 is pricey when i only get use of the work outs.    & something that i personally wish they had was a place where we can store our before/after pictures.
Title: wowzers

Content: I can't rate this app very well yet. Content: DO NOT purchase the full product! This is the first negative review I‚Äôve ever written. Will give it time but sad I didn‚Äôt know about the voice etc prior to subscribing.
Title: AI/Digital Sounding Voice is terrible

Content: This app is beyond useless. I could do these exercises in my sleep. Should I have lied about my age? I‚Äôm 57 but I‚Äôm not dead yet and I‚Äôm in shape so an app that has a workout that burns 4 calories per session seems a waste of time. I want real exercises to help strengthen my core and muscles. Content: So doable. By answering a few questions you are directed to just the right program for you. When you complete it for the first time you have a chance to lighten it or make it more challenging. I‚Äôve just started but I think it‚Äôs a great fit for me.

Content: I have been using this app mainly for tracking my water intake and the workouts they offer. And I have definitely noticed a difference in my body shape and strength since using this app almost everyday for the past month. (I am following a diet plan but no through this app)

Title: Awful

Title: DON‚ÄôT WASTE YOUR TIME ON THIS APP

Content: Day 1 of exercising for the first time in many, many months. With my mobility, gait, and breathing  disorder this 11 minute workout was a definitely a challenge to my deconditioned body. But I feel better physically and emotionally than before I began. This just the beginning.

Title: Needs tweaking

Why not do all of the standing work at one time, and then all of the seated work at one time it didn‚Äôt make sense it was very disjointed, and not really a great work out. If I could get my money back right now, I would take it and find a better wall work out.

Title: Awesome!!!

Content: If I wouldn‚Äôt had paid attention, I would have been suckered out of quite a bit of money over time. There are a lot of small upsell charges that you receive when using different services in the app. Many of these are not clearly identified and you can opt into them without realizing it. After noticing a number of extra charges on my billing statement, I contacted support only to find that I had ‚Äúopted in‚Äù to extra services.
Title: Check your billing statements carefully

After you pay you choose from the meal plans they already have pre set, nothing about the meals are personalized to fit you. It was absolutely a waste of money. If you are picky with your foods this isn‚Äôt for you. Other meal plans do a better job of actually making you a personalized meal plan based off what you like or dislike and what you can or can‚Äôt eat. Better me is definitely a scam.

Oh, and their help section consists of ‚ÄúHow do I cancel my subscription‚Äù but then they WON‚ÄôT cancel your subscription and REFUND you when you ask them to!! Absolute scam and should be shut down entirely!!!!
Title: It‚Äôs a trap!!

Content: I‚Äôve been using this app for a few months and previously there wasn‚Äôt a narration that‚Äôs plays with the workout videos but there‚Äôs no way to toggle this voice/narration off. It plays for every single workout, the warm up and cool down, playing over the music that is an option to play through the app. Please fix this, it‚Äôs too distracting to not be optional.
Title: The app is fine but

Content: I was doing pretty good losing weight and all, then I woke up this morning to them saying I have to pay from now on to use the app. I understand that they want to collect money and all, but they should‚Äôve let me know that it was like a 2 week free trial or something. Overall, I‚Äôm pretty disappointed cause I was making progress. I would look at other apps first then come to this one.
Title: Love... but

Content: It‚Äôs a great app I truly love and it is helping me a lot, but the fact that I it won‚Äôt let me do my courses because I won‚Äôt pay for a membership is a bit irritating, I just wish that you didn‚Äôt have to pay to be able to continue and grow. But overall a great app, but the paying method kinda of ruined it for me.
Title: Paying

Content: After years of neglecting my body I‚Äôm getting back into a routine. While I love that there videos showing you how you should do the workouts what I do not like is that there is no audio and it flows from one move to the next without any time to adjust. This is especially so for the timed parts (like run in place for 10 seconds). It would be nice if there was vocal instruction and then a small pop up in the corner of what‚Äôs next.
Title: Just started

Content: Pretty cool. Workouts are just right for this not very fit 77 year old man. I really like the way the workouts are set up. The video walks you through the whole process. Use the diet suggestions as a calorie guideline. Then mostly ad lib.  Feeling good.
Title: Just right so far.

Content: I wanted an awesome app that would help me exercise. I thought I found it until i got to day two... if you don‚Äôt buy the program it doesn‚Äôt provide the exercises.  Everything after day one locked up.  I really liked the automation and the ease of use, but I‚Äôm not going to pay for this app. How about add some advertising and make it free?
Title: Not free

Content: I purchased the lifetime membership. The exercises build up every day but when day 28 is over, the program starts completely over. One would think that it would open up a new level of workouts. If you're serious about getting into shape, don't buy the lifetime membership. Purchase a month at a time. Now I have to find another work out app. I wasted about $30. Live and learn, I guess... 2 stars instead of 5 BetterMe.
Title: Loved it  for 28 days

Content: This app was great. It had a little daily task list to help you stay accountable. Now when I open the app I see it for 2 seconds and then the app flips to go to workout and I can not go back to the daily task list ever. Instead you have to slog through and find the statistics part and log weight there then deal with another list to do steps, calories and so on. It is terrible now.
Title: What Happened?!

Content: DO NOT GET THIS AT ALL COSTS!!! First of all, I signed up for a free trial and was charged. Second, I went to cancel my subscription and that option was no where to be found in the app. I went to the website and sure enough magically my email and password combination was not in their system. Therefore, I was locked out of everything, with no way to cancel my subscription. They have no real customer support service whatsoever. Experience is absolutely miserable.
Title: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE TRAP

Content: I purchased this app and was very excited about using it.  I had gotten sick for two weeks. Since they charge per month I tried to contact Better Me to have them restart my month.  I was referred to their JUST ANSWER resolution center.  In order to get help they requested I pay them $1 which would be refunded.  My problem went unresolved and then I was charged $46 on top of the $1.  I had to dispute this with my credit card company ü§¨ Scam scam scam!!!
Title: Fraud Alert

Content: Only on second day, I‚Äôm sure I will get better at it but it would be helpful it you gave a little notice that the next exercise is on the floor or standing.  I like the pace but have to keep hitting pause in order to get into position.  Just a thought for beginners.  Thanks
Title: Notice

Content: Used it for three days and got frustrated by day 3.  I like to eat the same thing multiple times a week, and the nutrition entering is annoying. The ‚Äúrecent‚Äù list of foods isn‚Äôt long enough. So I either have to re scan a food or recreate manually because nothing in the library matches my food exactly and the one I entered a day or two prior doesn‚Äôt pop up. I should be able to save foods into my own personal library for ease of re use.  Also, the fact that it doesn‚Äôt show my breakfast/lunch/dinner calorie totals is a huge shortcoming. I have to add everything up to figure it out.   Switching to My Fitness Pal.

Content: I had the app, I got rid of it. I don‚Äôt need all the meal and calorie tracking. I don‚Äôt need a plan or program. I just wanted the wall Pilates exercises and you can‚Äôt get that with paying money for a bunch of junk I don‚Äôt need. Content: The work out program is awesome, you can log your calories and even schedule your next work out. I really recommend this app if you are trying to gain or lose wait

Content: As someone who works in an office all day, and doesn‚Äôt have a ton of time to spend at a gym, I needed something that would put together well designed workouts for me, and that would give me a workout schedule aimed at achieving results.  BetterMe nailed it!  I have been using the app for about 5 months, and I have lost 20lbs and gained  a ton of strength and definition.  I was a college athlete, and at 52 yrs old, I now have almost the physique that I had in college.   The workouts are clear and easy to follow, without a lot of extra ‚Äúchatter‚Äù (which I don‚Äôt need or want).  The app allows you to set your specific goals, and provides a lot o flexibility to do more or less on any given day, by supplementing the workout that the app selects with additional exercises of your choosing.   In addition, I got a lot out of the intermittent fasting program, and the food tracker, which allowed me to ‚Äúreset‚Äù my relationship with food.  This was a surprise to me, as I did not expect to use these tools.  Generally, I don‚Äôt need to use those functions anymore (other than very sporadically), but they were essential to getting me into good routines and habits. (I am a good cook and generally understand nutrition, so I did not use the meal plan function, but it could provide helpful direction to some).   I cannot recommend this app more highly.  It might not be for everyone, but if what you need is some structure, a schedule, and straightforward workout routines handed to you on a platter, this fits the bill.  And it produces results!

Content: I want to rate 5 star but for having to pay for the app I expect less technical issues. I‚Äôll be on track for trophies and proud of my consistency then the app won‚Äôt load or needs to logged out/back in. When that happens I loose my streaks and trophies which motivate me. I have to start meditation and reading back from day 1. The longest streak I‚Äôve had was 15 days then I had to uninstall and reinstall again putting me back at day 1. I‚Äôve only had the app 28 days but have had this happen 4x already. But I‚Äôm trying to stay motivated even though I have to keep starting back at day 1. For people trying to reach a 28 day streak- good luck. You‚Äôll have to just stay personally motivated even though an app you‚Äôre paying to work isn‚Äôt. It does maintain your weight, and workouts but loses food and water tracking every time this happens too, so you either relog your food/water or miss your streak that day too. My favorite part is the reading and meditation but I don‚Äôt know yet what comes after day 15 since I‚Äôm continually getting put back to day 1- not sure if this is also why I‚Äôm not seeing my workouts get more intense but there is no progression from when I started a month ago.  It‚Äôs easy and keeps me accountable which is the only reason I paid for this subscription/app. If you want to seek out additional workouts you can and they have great customer service which is why I changed my review from a 3 star to 4 star. They responded quickly to my feedback and have since been checking on me and encouraging my progress.

Content: I decided to give this app a try, even though I don‚Äôt like paying for exercise apps, because I‚Äôm pretty athletic and know a lot, but I wanted some extra ideas and workouts to add into my days. So I am on day three of this app, and so far, I‚Äôm really enjoying, for the most part, doing the exercises. I love how there‚Äôs a variety of different exercises for fitness levels, age, mobility, etc. My only problem is this. I just did the HIIT Session work out for the first time. It‚Äôs the first workout in the HITT category. I liked the exercises, but there were a lot of glitches. A lot of the instruction was not matching up to what the athlete was doing in the video. Also, as time went on, the video was not advancing. So as I‚Äôm doing the advanced Burpee exercise, I found myself doing it for over five minutes, and I found that extremely odd. Then I thought well maybe they‚Äôre boosting the time, to add intensity. But, that definitely was not the case. When I hit the fast forward button, it went right into the exercise, and then switch to the next one. The next one is demonstrated, and then it stayed on, again, for an extended amount of time. Again I had to advance it manually to the next. This happened with numerous exercises and was very frustrating. A workout that was supposed to be 32 minutes long ended up being almost 50 minutes. So this definitely needs to be resolved. Other than that I have enjoyed the app, so far. I need to explore more of it to see what else it offers.

Content: I cancelled the ‚Äúfree‚Äù trial within a week back in early November because I realized right away it was not going to work out for me. They send you an email saying they‚Äôre sorry to see you go, then ask you to unsubscribe by clicking a button, which only brings you to the homepage of the app with no further instructions. I assumed this was their way of handling things and that it was cancelled. I then received a $15 charge, then later in November and in December I received two more $30 charges, trying to cancel over and over again the entire time. I finally received an email last week saying a ‚Äúhuman‚Äù would get back to me within 8 hours and that was 5 days ago. I honestly have no idea how to cancel this and get my money back, short of pulling my card and then worrying about credit issues. The customer service is awful, really the worst ever. It‚Äôs like someone decided to start an app and never realized some people would actually want to cancel at some point, and that they needed to have a customer service department to handle things. It‚Äôs like it doesn‚Äôt exist at all.   **UPDATE: customer service did eventually get in touch with me and were extremely polite and professional, despite my initial aggravated attitude. I really appreciated that, as it‚Äôs something that‚Äôs truly lacking in society today. I also received every dime back, which I was not expecting. My personal needs still require something other than a home workout app, but the company seems willing to do whatever they need to do to make the experience better for those who can use this sort of program. I‚Äôm hoping they will make some of their customer service processes easier to navigate so they won‚Äôt continue to get poor reviews.

Content: I wrote to support about resetting to start my start date. They sent out the form email telling me to visit their answers section, and if I still needed help it provided a broken link. My ‚Äúcoach‚Äù continues to remind me of logging meals and water when I haven‚Äôt been on there in weeks. I was actually only on there a few days. The food tracker is not well put together. The units are messed up and it forces you to choose in a way that doesn‚Äôt represent how much you ate or the calories. Even when you attempt to create your own. I have limited mobility, so I really appreciated the wheelchair workouts. Also, when it tells you to rate your level of fitness by performing certain movements, it doesn‚Äôt considerate limited mobility or disabled. They‚Äôve asked me to respond with the 7 digit number to my email???? What is that?  Update November 10th: Still no support. So, I cancelled. They just keep sending the notifications for me to log food and water and weight and to exercise. ‚Äîdespite the fact there has been no logging or accessing the app in 2 months. Early on they only pretended to respond to my request for help because Apple sent an email to both of us. They told me to respond with the 7 digit number to my email. There is no seven digit number, and they could‚Äôve responded on here, but they chose not to. I have been trying to reach then since a week after I paid for the app. It‚Äôs paid for for three months and it will expire in a few weeks. I won‚Äôt renew, but will share this in my 250,000 online writing group.

Content: I started with the free 7 day trial to check out this app. While I enjoy the variety of menu options and workouts available, the extent of menus offered and workouts seems limited. If I were to decide to extend my free trial and pay for the subscription I have concerns about the amount of available content in their library, to sustain the program for an entire 6 months or even a year.  At this time, paying for the subscription service at the end of my free trial is not right option for me. I will wait until after the holidays when I am better able to follow the plan to a ‚Äút.‚Äù  On the other hand, I have to say I am getting frustrated about the lack of response/support from their support team. I read through all the terms & conditions and my understanding is I will automatically be charged for the ‚Äúpremium subscription‚Äù if I do not cancel the service 24hrs prior to the end of my free trial (tomorrow). It states that the user can disable ‚Äúauto renewing‚Äù of the paid subscription in the users Account settings. However, there is no option to disable this in my Acct settings on the BetterMe app. I emailed their support team but have not received any response or feedback yet as to how to do this, to ensure I will not incur a charge when my free trial ends tomorrow. I will be very upset if I am charged for anything - especially as I was very careful before signing up for the free trial to make sure it could be canceled at anytime without any charges, if it was done 24hrs in advance. After trying to do this on my own to no avail and then reaching out to their team for support, I will not be happy if they do not get back to me today so I am not charged for extending a subscription I did not elect to pay for.

Content: Overall I would say that my experience has not been good. When I set up my profile, I chose the diet settings that most closely represented my eating habits. It said that was intermittent fasting and added that to my personal daily goals on the home page. I went to change it so that I could remove it and was able to change my diet preferences, but the fasting stayed on my home page. I also tried out the food log and found it very frustrating. It doesn‚Äôt recognize a lot of foods and is limited in the information you can input for food you have to manually add.  I also purchased some challenges since they were on sale. The personal coach really just feels like a robot. They are not very engaging or interactive. The coach uploads the exercises everyday at the time that you made the purchase (so hopefully you didn‚Äôt purchase them late at night)! You have to start the challenge the day you purchased it if you want to properly track your progress through the app (otherwise it will say that you failed that day). All the exercises are not directly connected to the challenge. They get uploaded to your inbox. And you cannot delete any of your old messages or organize them in any way so you have to sift through all your messages and figure out which one you‚Äôre looking for. When you do do your workout for the day, some of the videos don‚Äôt explain the exercise prior to you starting it and there‚Äôs no count down or beeps to notify you when an exercise starts or stops so you have to be paying attention to the video. The challenge might also have a different name than advertised after you purchase it, so that can be slightly confusing.   The only upside is that since the messages never delete, the exercises are there for you to use whenever you get around to them. The lack of continuity within the app really takes away from the experience.
Title: Not User Friendly

Content: I subscribed about 5 days ago and like it so far. I was having an issue after I paid for my subscription. I downloaded the app on my iPad because I prefer to have the bigger screen for the workouts. But when I tried to sign in it didn‚Äôt recognize any of my info. It was extremely frustrating at first because I paid for this. Plus I was about to buy a new phone that day and wanted to have it logged on the new phone for the notifications.  So I emailed them like 6:30 am my time. I wasn‚Äôt expecting a fast response due to my time zone but minutes later I received an email. I found out in a search they‚Äôre Uk time zone. The person responding was very friendly. But she couldn‚Äôt find my email or login or anything. So she suggested sending screenshots of my subscription and stuff.  Anyway l was just getting frustrated and ready to cancel because I have little patience (something I‚Äôm working on) but they really was patient with me and very friendly and finally came up with a simple solution to get me logged on.   Great customer service means a lot to me. So that alone gets 5 stars. Also I like the workout options. I would say it would be nice if there were more of the body positive workouts. But the variety of workouts is pretty good. I did a partial boxing workout after a body positive one which I‚Äôm feeling.   Someone left a review saying they don‚Äôt need the meal plan and that meals need a separate app? That‚Äôs kind of a dumb suggestion. While I don‚Äôt have to have a meal plan, I do like it. I‚Äôm On the keto diet and get bored with my own meals. So it‚Äôs nice this app has a keto diet category where I can get some different meal ideas. Overall I‚Äôm happy with this app. I‚Äôm using it and it‚Äôs motivating.

Content: I have mixed feelings about this app because I like it but at the same time I don‚Äôt. So prior to this app I was (am) using the app Workout for Women but I heard about this app on Instagram and I thought I might try it. I‚Äôm currently doing the one week free trial (and I‚Äôm so glad I did because my mixed feelings are making me feel unsure of paying the $10 weekly) and I think they‚Äôre meal plans are AH-MAZING! They‚Äôre easy, delicious, and within your calorie limit not to mention healthy (duh). I guess my mixed feeling are in the workouts, they‚Äôre great BUT I reeeeeally wish that it counted for me the reps because personally, I HATE counting when I‚Äôm doing an exercise. I‚Äôm so focused on working the part of my body I‚Äôm exercising I either lose track and have to start all over, over count, or am counting and don‚Äôt really work on the area of my body. And that‚Äôs what I like about my other app, it counts for me (in seconds) and I just focus on going working the area of my body until the timer runs out.  My suggestion: Before every exercise it counts down from 10 and if the exercise is, let‚Äôs say, 25 reps, once the bell rings (initiating the exercise) the doll demonstrating starts doing the 25 reps and we can follow at the speed their doing the exercise (you could even show the number of times she‚Äôs performing them that way theirs no need to keep track because your seeing it on the screen). I‚Äôm telling you, the app has that and I ditch my other app in a heart beat. The entire time I was exercising I was thinking ‚Äòoh how I wish I didn‚Äôt have to count!‚Äôüò© lol. I think this app is good but the fact that I don‚Äôt feel like I can work my body properly because of the counting (as stupid as that sounds) just keeps me from thinking it‚Äôs great. I ended up going back to my other app, although I will still be using this app. I‚Äôm gonna use my week trial just to see how I feel about it through the end.ü§û

Content: Company is very dubious to work with. I signed up because I was really excited to do the somatic body type exercises and once I signed up what I was being pushed the most was lifestyle and diet changes, which is not what I had originally thought I was signing up for!! The marketing was incredibly misleading as all the marketing showed were the exercises with no hint of the app also being a lifestyle and diet app. I‚Äôm sure some people can use this, but this is not what I need. I‚Äôm a survivor of quite a lot of trauma, and have quite a lot of ptsd so I‚Äôm aware of what my challenges are. My diet is actually already really good, I work in the health care business.   Upon trying to log into the app and use it to give it a chance, I couldn‚Äôt get in as the app wanted me to pay again, a bug on Betterme‚Äôs end, so I‚Äôve reached out to customer support four or five times, at least, and have just been written back and am ignored again when I asked for a refund, so essentially I paid for a service I couldn‚Äôt use and paid for some thing that I wouldn‚Äôt have bought if the company had been more transparent with what their services were.   Customer service has been terrible and $40 (trial week plus monthly membership fee) is quite a lot of money to pay for something I couldn‚Äôt use. My advise is don‚Äôt sign up with these guys. I‚Äôm halfway on the fence to just reporting them to my bank and getting my money back.  As of today a whole month later the tech team has finally put in the cancel subscription button and I can finally get logged in after they took my money and sat on it for over a month with zero service access and no customer service despite trying to reach them repeatedly. This is a Terrible company and that has terrible service. Do not use!!!

That being said I‚Äôve tried to change my meal plan since I started but it is still on the same one I first selected it reads that it has changed on my profile but it hasn‚Äôt when I look at the food section.  Also, should put a search engine for the food search so that I don‚Äôt waste time looking at everything just have to type in egg for example and that will then populate all recipes with egg in it. Another suggestion is to categorize the food but breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack, treats. I use to use this app that would track everything I ate made recommendations as well, but my favorite part and what helped me the most was that it knew the calories, sugars, proteins, sodium, etc. in all foods and if it did not know it you could add them in or scan the nutritional value label of each product to make a combined and better out come at least I noticed that worked great for me and everyone that I knew was doing the same.   Another suggestion is that you also have an alarm or reminder of sorts to remind people like me with two kids a husband or just plain forgetful for everything like meals or water intake or just fit in a quick workout where ever I am.  Lastly, I keep forgetting to log my water in take or other things so maybe allow access to in our previous day(s) like minimal access to avoid lying...  Warmest Regards,  Jennifer R.

Content: First of all I do like the app. However I previously used the myplate app and there were a few things I liked about it better but unfortunately they discontinued the app.   When calorie tracking on Myplate, in the space on the right side of the search bar for food, they had the barcode icon right there so it was easy to click without having to go into another menu to select. Just hit it and scan to track. It would almost always come up with the right serving size and information‚Ä¶ Also they offered a paid plan that would track micronutrients in food as well. It‚Äôs beneficial if you know you should be supplementing certain nutrients and want to do it through diet vs pills. This app doesn‚Äôt have that feature. When giving daily calorie recommendations MyPlate took into consideration resting and active energy consumption from the apple health app as well as your weight goals to give recommendations. I‚Äôm curious if BetterMe does this as well or not?   Also I know the calorie tracker on this app has recent foods underneath the search menu but they aren‚Äôt specific to that meal (ie. breakfast) by the time I get to breakfast the following day what I had for breakfast the previous day is not there anymore because I added lunch and dinner after. Perhaps instead of recent searches just have a history for that meal. I eat overnight oats frequently and I have to search for and add the milk, oats, chai seeds, etc all every time because it‚Äôs been bumped out of the recents menu by lunch and dinner.   I really do like the app there‚Äôs just little things like that would make it way more user friendly. Keep up the good work and thanks for what you do. I enjoy the fasting information and recommended workout routines.

Content: I purchased the app thinking the cost of the app was the only purchase needed. If you want a meal plan and or join any of the challenges/workouts you have to spend an additional cost for each of those. Plus an additional cost for subscription which they don‚Äôt keep track of any of your purchases so you have to show proof of purchases because they don‚Äôt keep any records of them. My trainer said I hadn‚Äôt purchased anything yet but I sent him a screenshot and clearly I had, but apparently it was just for having a coach who frankly hasn‚Äôt helped me yet.   Didn‚Äôt give me my money back even though I never used any of their workouts or articles. Complete waste of $50! You could easily spend $100+ bucks with their clever pop up ads for their different programs when you least expect it and if you were already about to click on something then you accidentally purchased a program you didn‚Äôt have time to look into first. That‚Äôs what happened to me and I said, I‚Äôm out of this rat trap! Don‚Äôt waste your time, otherwise you‚Äôll be spending a lot of money that you will never get back.  Update: ugh!! Finally they paid me back what was rightfully mine but then out of the blue charged me again and I had already deleted the app and the subscription off my phone and still I got charged for the silly app. I don‚Äôt understand how there are even good reviews for this app it‚Äôs a complete waste of money and time. The time I spend emailing these robbers trying to get my money back I could be in better shape by now. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money. This is an honest to goodness review, don‚Äôt trust the other reviews because they probably got paid to say those things.

Content: I signed up for this app but with everything going on with the pandemic was unable to use it so want to cancel it. There‚Äôs no place in the app to cancel it so it renewed by the time the customer service responded to me. They then did cancel it with charge me $20 for the next month and it was right at the day of renewal that I had tried canceling but was unable to because that was not in the app. Customer service responded with a generic response to my concern and then went Ghost for 4 days and came back with the same generic response. Total scam - if you want to be so strict with your policies you should make it where customers can cancel subscriptions on their own in the app not wait a day for customer service. I‚Äôd give this app ZERO stars I could!! I‚Äôve been using iPhones and iOS since 2007 -I‚Äôve never given a bad review until today because I don‚Äôt appreciate companies that trap you into continuing to pay.  In response to the developers comments: Your company has updated the App fourteen times just in the past month - I can assure you I was unable to find a cancel subscription section when I had looked to cancel. That being said, it doesn‚Äôt change the fact that your customer service has gave me a generic response and then ignored messages for days to only provide a similar generic response. As a business owner my request for your service that I never used and was unable to cancel on my own did not seem unreasonable as I would gladly refund any of my customers that don‚Äôt use my products or service and make the effort to cancel in a timely manner but in the digital space once you have my billing info it‚Äôs ‚ÄúGotcha‚Äù
Title: Scam - no way to cancel subscription

Content: Everything about this app sounded great! I came across it on Pinterest. $30 for 6 months and a 7 day free trial week sounded like a great deal! BUT, it charged my card for the 6 months right away and NO free trial. I like it as a basic logging app, BUT the calories are ALL wrong on their end. I have to look up calories on the web all the time. Everything automatically comes up at 3.53 ounces and high calorie counts. Even when you use the barcode scan option, so watch that! A lot of times the recipes are very vague for amounts of ingredients needed AND the picture is not what the recipe actually is. EX: flaxseed crepes with cream cheese and salmon, but shows a picture of crepes with bananas and cream. LOL...what? In the beginning (one week ago) I was able to look at future recipes and plan my meals so I could shop for the week, now I can only see my meals for the day. AND they are locked out!! So, I have to click on each recipe, then it pops up 2 more money wanting ads I have to close out before I can get to the recipe. Mind you, I‚Äôve already paid for the complete app with meal planning. Not a good way to meal plan. I don‚Äôt like to go to the store everyday. In addition to the meals they choose for you, it asks you to Change, Log, or Skip. When I log, it only asks if you would make the meal again...basically yes or no. If you say no, it wants to know why. It pops up a box AND you have to fill it out. The annoying part is, you then have to go into the tracker and log the calories. LOL...what‚Äôs the point of logging it on the recipe if it‚Äôs not going to log it for you in the tracker. A simple fix. Add the calories to the tracker. BUT, again the calories are not right most of the time, so watch that too. You could be robbing yourself of precious calories and may not be eating enough since their calorie count is ALWAYS much higher. Also, when you go to log the meal they provided, a lot of times it‚Äôs not even in their tracker menu lookup. So, it takes more time to track the meal because you have to find the calories for each ingredient you used. It also does it allow you to see what you have eaten and recorded thus far. Since I‚Äôm having to fix EVERY recipe for calorie intake, it‚Äôs quite annoying to have to look this stuff up everyday. Another problem with this site is the Contact Us option. It doesn‚Äôt even have auto correct, which is such a basic option for emails. I type fast and have to go back and fix basic mistakes that could be auto corrected. That‚Äôs a sign of a very cheap platform. The exercise programs are good, BUT act as if you should know the routine already. It could offer some sort of indicator to the next exercise coming up. The most annoying and time consuming part to me is the calorie counter. I have gone into settings and all is checked for the correct measurement units, but still does not work right. It‚Äôs only been 5 days for me and I‚Äôve experienced this much disappointment already. Hopefully they fix a these major issues so it makes it worth the time I signed up.   When you sign up, it offers a 100% satisfaction guarantee or your money back. But after reading the customer reviews, and the responses from BetterMe, it does not seem to address anyone‚Äôs issues. The responses are all vague and do not seem to solve the problems. Bots must be responding.    Come on guys, fix the app!!! This is ridiculous. You‚Äôre taking people‚Äôs money, but not following through with what you offer in your advertisement to join. It has potential, BUT needs a ton of work. If I had known all these issues I would spend my money on another more dependable app.  Keep looking consumers, do not signup for this app. It‚Äôs a rip-off.
Title: Don‚Äôt Fall for It!!

Content: I really like the comprehensive approach this app is built around. As a retired psychotherapist I can also attest to the quality of the psychological section, if fits into up to date psychological thinking and I found personally helpful. The tracking of the day‚Äôs water intake is fine.   Where the app really falls into almost uselessness is the calorie tracking function. Examples are: calories are only totaled on a  ‚ÄúWhat you have eaten so far‚Äù basis. There are no totals for each individual meal. Since I am able to subtract I can find the total but it is another step for the user. If you search for a food you could get 20 choices with inconsistent values. This is very confusing and confusing doubt that you are getting correct data. There are not useful measuring methods. I don‚Äôt need to know the calories for 3.5 ounces of olive oil, I need to know the calories for 1 Tablespoon. There needs to be many more options for measurement.  Another irritant is when you edit an item, it shows up at the top with only it‚Äôs name and measurement not the number of calories that measurement. I need that total because I have to check it with other sources in order to see if one tablespoon is equivalent to one ounce. Say I find that 1 tablespoon is equivalent to .5 ounces  The adjustment in the serving size does not allow an entry starting with a dismal point.  There are MANY other problems with the calorie tracking function but I have too much to do to list them. I suggest you take a look at other calorie counting apps. Try tracking you own meals for 2-3 days. I won‚Äôt sign up again as long as this function is so dysfunctional.

Content: I never write reviews, but I‚Äôm a developer and dancer so I wanted to give some suggestions to continue the great work this team has already started. I thoroughly enjoy what this app has to offer. LIKES: -Workouts broken down into problem areas -Rep suggestions, timers, skip feature -Beautiful graphics -Food options -Water tracker  SUGGESTIONS: -Modification options: I recently had a baby and need to work up to some of these exercises. I‚Äôm a dancer so I can modify myself, but know this would help others. -Accurate time duration. I‚Äôd like to know if I rushed my reps or took my time. Also, would like to know how this altered the calories burned. -360 view: there was one exercise I hadn‚Äôt done before, and it wasn‚Äôt clear to me from the side view. I know this would require a lot more development, but if you could spin the graphic or at least have the ability to have front and side views that would be ideal. -Menu: this is a good first gen, but could use more options (perhaps I‚Äôm only receiving 7 options because I‚Äôm still on the trial). I‚Äôd like to be able to ‚Äòfavorite‚Äô ones I like. It‚Äôd also be nice if these recipes shared a few ingredients so it made sense financially and practically. -More guided text. I like the completion screens but I‚Äôm not sure how that calculates into my goal. It‚Äôd be nice to have a progress bar in my profile and continue to move it along with every exercise. -Email sign up: I don‚Äôt have Facebook. Am I missing out on features because I can‚Äôt sign up? -More advanced exercises as you progress. I like to work towards goals. -Maybe a section for endurance? -It‚Äôd be cool to be able to do 28-day challenges with friends, track their progress, etc. It would give more incentive to use the app :) That‚Äôs all for now. Excited to see what else you guys come up with. Thanks!

Content: I really loved this app. But after all the issue I got from using the app, I and sad to say I am finally deleting it off my iPhone and I will be getting my final refund for the app. At first, the app was amazing, I first wanted to get a trial test and a feel for the app so I paid for the 7 day trial... no big deal right? Three days go by and I‚Äôm in love with the app and then suddenly, I can‚Äôt access the recipes then the app suggests that only for the 1 year membership? Cool, whatever, my 7 day trial is still not up so I figured ok I‚Äôll pay for the one year even though my 7 day is not up because I was gonna do that anyway. I pay $30 and I have access to the recipes again, yay me! Another week goes bay and I lose weight and everything. Then suddenly I lose access the recipes again!!!!? I payed the money and 1 year had not expired yet so what could be the issue? I email the customer service and anything that is related to better me and no response. It gets to the point where I have to contact Apple and of course they resolve my issue but I still love the app, the suggested I get my refund and try making another account using my email and not Apple ID. I do that to another $30 after I get my refund for the first try and I make another account using me email. BIG MISTAKE. Another week goes by after I pay and AGAIN I lose access to the recipes!? At this point I‚Äôm fed up and canceled and resubscribed like 20 times making sure I payed and still I cannot access the recipes!? This is the final time I will do this, I will permanently delete the app and not reinstall. I am waiting for my final refund and I suggest that to whoever is planing to get this app that you think twice about it.

Content: I was under the impression that this was a FREE app. I was very excited to get started and I started 4 of the programs (stomach, arms, legs and back) and did the first sessions. I was ready to be committed. After I finished day 1 of my ‚Äú28 day plans‚Äù it had me schedule a time for the second sessions the next day. Happy to find a workout from an app that I really liked, I tried to start my second lesson. Emphasis on TRIED. It wouldn‚Äôt let me proceed without SUBSCRIBING TO THEIR STUPID $9.99 /month service. I thought the full version was just to get additional features but NO. It‚Äôs to get access to the service in the first place. The worst part is the company tried to hide it. This is advertised as a FREE APP that has in app purchases. Their plan is to lure you in by simply downloading their free ‚Äúmiracle weight loss app‚Äù only to give you access to nothing besides the option to buy the full version. It‚Äôs DISGRACEFUL I‚Äôm a teenager who really needed this in my life and my mom is simply not willing to pay for me to get basic workouts (understandably so)  Dear developers,  I hope you enjoy cashing in on your coin. Just hope you know deep down inside that you‚Äôre scammers that are trying to take advantage of vulnerable and desperate people looking to make a healthy change in their lives. I bet you‚Äôre sleeping on beds made of cash while you laugh at the people who are desperate enough to fall victim to your trap. You‚Äôre supposed to be like a helpful source for people like me. You‚Äôre not. GOODBYE

Content: The concept of this app is good. I like that there are various workout plans and ways to record your diet. But I really got frustrated with the user friendliness of the app. I did the sugar challenge and the lessons that I was supposed to receive did not show up. They indicated this is something the team was working on, but it wasn‚Äôt resolved even after several days.  Email communications from the support team/coaches would pop up on my phone‚Äôs notifications but not in the actual chat box. The messages disappeared .  I attempted to update the app, but when I did that, my progress changed: it show that I had not completed all the lessons that I actually completed.   There is a significant delay in terms of when the coaches respond to you. I think that is mostly because of the difference in country. However, the coaches are very supportive.   There is a disconnect between the material, lessons, and the meal plans provided. I got confused in terms of what it is I should be doing.  For the sugar detox, I want you to include your meals. They need to have something similar like my fitness pal which recalls your meals as you start typing. This task is very tedious and if you‚Äôre in the United States, the measurements are different.   Finally because I was so frustrated, I decided to cancel the subscription. I decided to do it 15 days until the subscription. Normally a subscription allows you to continue with your current plan. With BetterMe, you lose your subscription plan immediately and all data is lost.

Title: A waste of $119

Content: I clicked on what was called a ‚Äòfree trial‚Äô in this app and then realized the app didn‚Äôt have what I expected and cancelled immediately. A week or so later, I came across the app again, forgot what it was, and clicked on the ‚Äòfree trial‚Äô again because clicking through is the only way to look at what the app provides. Apparently I was not eligible for the second ‚Äòfree trial‚Äô- although there were zero disclosures saying this- and my iTunes account was charged the full amount. I scrolled through the app and despite claims that you can ‚Äòcancel at any time‚Äô in the small print, no option to cancel exists. The app seemed to also put me into ‚Äòpremium‚Äô auto renewal service, and it‚Äôs taken me multiple calls and emails to Apple to try to fix this. Emails to a contact provided in this app did not receive any response.  UPDATE. Developer, after seeing how often this occurs and your lack of response other than to say ‚Äòtoo bad‚Äô,  I‚Äôm reporting this app and your misleading billing practices to the CA Attorney General as a violation of CA auto renewal laws, (as well as other state‚Äôs consumer protection laws and federal law). I suggest you amend your practices ASAP and provide refunds to the many MANY consumers on here who were clearly mislead and over charged. My contact after that will be to some CA consumer class action attorneys. Good luck.  FURTHER UPDATE: I received a response from the developer ‚Äòsorry, it‚Äôs Apple‚Äôs issue, we can‚Äôt help you‚Äô. Meanwhile, Apple pointed me to BetterMe saying ‚Äòit‚Äôs the app‚Äôs policy, we can‚Äôt help you.‚Äô In sum, I was charged 21 dollars for a ‚Äòfree trial‚Äô and both companies refuse to correct it (although both benefit from my payment and the payment of many others similarly mislead) and both are violating consumer protection laws. I will report both practices to my state Attorney General consumer protection division and to class action lawyers. I advise anyone on here to whom this has happened to do the same. Thanks

Content: I like this app but it‚Äôs not practical for the everyday busy lifestyle in regards to the meal plan specifically. For example, if I‚Äôm trying to plan out my meals for the next day & make sure I‚Äôm not going over my calorie intake, etc, it does NOT allow to ‚Äúlog meal‚Äù from the meal plan (or anything for that matter) for the next day or anytime in the future. It‚Äôs very strict on what you need to eat for the day, but I don‚Äôt always have king prawns, muesli, wheat bran, millet, or tabbouleh available....nor would that be easy for me to find at the grocery store & cook personally because I would have to research how-to first. Some of the meals can take an hour to cook, with grilling & baking involved, & sometimes I don‚Äôt have that kind of time nor can I heat up my house that way during the summer. It‚Äôs also extremely difficult to find food in the search bar to log in food that isn‚Äôt in the meal plan. I tried adding Starbucks egg white bites & it‚Äôs no where to be found. So if you want to steer off the meal plan by finding another healthy option, it‚Äôs really hard to do! The measuring guide & cooking instructions are confusing too. If you want to cook 3 eggs for breakfast, then it will list the eggs as ‚Äúeggs - 3 pcs‚Äù, but for a snack of just ‚Äúolives‚Äù (no idea if we‚Äôre talking black olives, Kalamata olives, castlevetrano olives, garlic stuffed olives) then the meal plan lists as ‚Äúolives - 50 grams‚Äù. Really? From a quick google search, I have to guess that 50 grams worth of olives is 9 olives? Not the end of the world, but like I said, not really convenient when you don‚Äôt have a lot of time & you‚Äôre trying to meal prep for the next day - or worse, you didn‚Äôt meal prep, you need to eat right now, & you have no idea how many grams everything is. Almost everything is listed in grams. I‚Äôm not familiar with grams so I have to google each ingredient in the meal plan to not slip up on portions.   The cooking instructions are definitely missing key information.  ‚ÄúStep 1 - Boil pre-soaked lentils‚Äù........how long do you pre-soak lentils for? Overnight? A few minutes? How long do I boil the lentils thereafter for exactly? No clue. Back to google again.  ‚ÄúStep 1 - Slice the eggplant into thin pieces, cook it on the grill or pan‚Äù............HOW? How long do I cook it in a pan? Do I need olive oil first? Do I need to put salt in it to dry it out & then dab it with a napkin before baking, like when you‚Äôre making Eggplant Parmesan? Tell me literally everything please because I do not know. Give me a link with more info if the character limit is that limited.  Suggestions:  - The ability to ‚Äúlog meals‚Äù for future dates in order to avoid going over the calorie, protein, & fat limits (aka to avoid slipping).   - The ability to add more information about foods that you can‚Äôt find in the search bar, like the protein & fat, instead of just calories. When I googled that egg white bites have 170 calories, I was able to ‚Äúadd food‚Äù, but not input that the protein was 13 grams.  - It would be easier if this app could synch with the Fitness Pal app, especially to find foods that are not in the meal plan.  - Clear, step-by-step cooking instructions for beginners.  ***PROS to this App:  - Love that you can track your water intake  - Love the ‚Äú‚òùÔ∏è‚Äù suggestions for the meal plans if you want to substitute something because you have an allergy, don‚Äôt like fish, etc.  - Love that there is a gluten-free meal plan  - Love the step-by-step workouts & variety of workouts available  - Love the fasting option  - Love the trophies earned for logging in daily to keep up motivation  Thank you!
Title: Like App but needs more convenience with meal plans

Content: My favorite thing about this are the menu items available and how you can plan for a week and move ingredients to a shopping list. The things that need improvement are: -strange measurements in the recipes (1/5th a cup or 0.01 oz of salt) -you cannot alter ingredients in a meal to correct the calorie count if you don‚Äôt use an ingredient  -there is no way to save the menu items you tried and liked so you can print them off. I‚Äôve just been having to write them all down by hand.  -If you enter calories for something off the menu, that is not saved as a quick item. You have to re-enter the name and calories each time.  -when you click ‚Äúlog‚Äù underneath a meal, it just asks if you liked it and you have to go to the meal area to manually search for the recipe and add it -you can‚Äôt enter calories burned in any way other than their planned workouts. So if you can‚Äôt do walking anymore, you can‚Äôt log calories burned in another form of exercise.  -the app gives you a ‚Äúcheck list‚Äù for the day. If you don‚Äôt weigh yourself, drink enough water, log your meals, do your planned exercise, you won‚Äôt get a ‚Äúcomplete‚Äù for the day. Several days my calories fell just below the needed number by a few calories so I added calories just to get the ‚Äúcheck‚Äù for the day. If you‚Äôre a completionist and trying to aim for getting ‚Äúcompletes‚Äù each day, this is annoying.  -there is no search by food option. I bought kale for a recipe and because I didn‚Äôt want the rest to go to waste, I had to scroll through all the recipes to find the ones I could use kale with.  -the search for food items need to be improved (ex: no chicken nuggets from McDonalds) to allow for honest reporting of food intake.

Content: I actually loved the free trial set up. They gave me a bomb work out, had work outs I actually wanted to do that weren‚Äôt cheesy, odd and nothing you wouldn‚Äôt be familiar with and have experienced with a face to face trainer.  I was super pumped when I got a Valentine‚Äôs Day special and then things went sour & no matter how many times I try to use this app or a work out in it I just can‚Äôt get into. Not can I find ANY of the work outs I did with the free trial...so there‚Äôs that.   Once I purchased my year subscription, bared by the special and the super easy but effective trial work outs...Holy moly it was like getting a completely different app I‚Äôd never seen before and had no idea how to navigate. Idk why in the heck things changed so drastically but I do not like a darn thing about this app after the free trial.   Honestly these work outs are all pretty much the same, set up in different orders to seem like you‚Äôre getting a lot for your $$. Whats worse, if you want to pair your smart watch with the app, be prepared to charge your watch 2-4 times a day bc this app has to have ALL the features turned on with your watch in order to ‚Äúwork‚Äù, unlike other apps where you can pick and choose which features the app can use tailored to you.   There is no ability to use their work outs and make your own tailored work out with their stuff that works best for you and is more personalized. The ‚Äúcoaches‚Äù cost ADDITIONAL $$$ & A LOT more.   This wasn‚Äôt worth the money and is a huge waste of time. There are other apps out there that don‚Äôt cost and have the same exact features as this one and better work outs...that are easier to navigate, personalize and enjoy.  I‚Äôve tried contacting the better me support over literally all of these things, however no matter how many comments or help forums I send them, the response is always a black bar at the top that says ‚Äúall comments failed to load‚Äù even tho the inbox claims I have multiple responses (I cannot read) waiting for me to see, they close out the tickets after 7-10 days of no response...but how is one to respond when the chat is always failing? I check it multiple times a day to see if maybe I‚Äôll be able to see any of my chat tickets I have opened, alas nothing. I‚Äôve uninstalled and reinstalled many times and have gotten no where.  Good luck, may the odds be ever in your favor but I doubt it...sorry y‚Äôall

Content: I really liked the idea where an app would log calories, exercise, water and give me both meal and exercise recommendations. The whole idea is it‚Äôs simpler to track one aggregated rather than many right? Wrong. It has so far deleted data from all my inputs where I have to re-enter, but that‚Äôs not even half the problem.  The calorie tracker isn‚Äôt even half baked- I subscribe to meal services like daily harvest and freshly, all of their meals/cups/smoothies have their nutritional values posted online, well finding them on this app will be like blues clues gone wrong (hint: get used to typing it all up yourself, then having the app delete that so you do it all over again). The scanning is also dismal, as when you do scan an Item, if it even finds the barcode, the only option is to then change the intake in ounces- good luck converting all your serving sizes now matter what type of food or liquid, to ounces.   Then water- you have to manually add, can‚Äôt link to an app where this might be tracked (I use hidratespark)  Exercise, the moment you don‚Äôt click next, or complete, it deletes the data as if you did not exercise at all, so you can go through it all by clicking but all of your values in regards to length/calories burnt etc will be gone.   The only thing that does come through is number of steps but you know what? I have basic apple apps for that I didn‚Äôt have to pay extra for.   Seems like anything that felt enticing is also a ‚Äúchallenge‚Äù that you would have to pay additional for, but given the crap I got for my initial purchase, I think not.

Content: Just under 5 hours, the truth reveals itself . . . Better Me is a scam and will steal your money without trace. I NEVER do reviews, BUT this is one that I CANNOT ignore so I can help someone else.   This app seemed AMAZING from start and until I purchase the 6-month subscription. Afterwards, this is a complete and total mess.   As a mom of a three year old and a three month old, this app seemed like an answer prayer to get back in shape and health, I felt like I got kicked in the stomach and beat up to the ground for the $180.   Your app states, "To request a refund, follow these instructions from the Apple support page." I want to cover all of my bases for a large purchase from the app store.   1) The initial 7-day trial of $10. This should have been waved for reason number 2.  2) I decided to purchase the 6-month subscription to save me "20% of total purchase," and the $10 subscription fee was shown as a negative for my total subscription purchase. 3) I purchased a premium meal plan and workouts, but it is not working correctly when I log out and back into it. I tried three times and still removed my information except for my steps because it is connected to the health in the iPhone. I cannot properly track my information to a Better Me.  4) Any subscription that is purchased from the Apple store will be a receipt, of which there is no receipt in my email. Secondly, you can view all subscriptions in the app store along with the renewal date, which Better Me does not appear on my list. It appears on "Purchased," which is not the proper place. Next, when I review my app, it appears as "free". This is not right or correct. Lastly, "To request a refund, follow these instructions from the Apple support page," The Better Me app does not appear as a subscription purchase and Apple cannot refund any purchase, in turn, which Apple cannot trace to refund the money. 5) Due to the above reasons, I would like an immediate refund. You‚Äôve been emailed today. I highly doubt it will be received and refund honored.

Content: I have never written a review as negative as this so do hope readers take the time to consider this.  On principle I was looking forward to utilizing the app, including buying the several up selling features, but little did I appreciate there was much more to be known.  An example is once launching the app it started the fasting period at noon, ending at 4 a.m.  I don‚Äôt know about you but I don‚Äôt get up at 4 a.m. nor am I interested in eating.  No assistance or easy guidance on how to change.  I tried the chat as well, no meaningful response.  Next was I pulled up the day one of the menu.  Everything involved at least 30 minutes of preparation with ingredients that aren‚Äôt readily available, even in my grocery store.  Good example is one meal called for squid.  I looked for a feature where you can select a different meal or put in what foods you don‚Äôt like.  For example I don‚Äôt eat shellfish, rarely food seafood at home.  You can select entire diet styles like vegan and Mediterranean, but I‚Äôm not necessarily any of the other diet styles and even still suspect squid would still appear.  Day 1 really?    With an 8 hour window to eat I realistically don‚Äôt know how the 4 or 5 meals and snacks could be put together and ate while trying to put in a work day.  Any realistic diet would have more choices that are easily put together and require less cooking.  Don‚Äôt get me wrong I cook and I cook frequently at home, but every meal?  Then when I navigated back to the Home Screen (this is on day 0, as I hadn‚Äôt even had a chance to use the app yet).  It showed me on day 2.  Next it was so complicated with minimal to no overview on how the whole thing fit together between the exercise, fasting and meal plan portions.  I did pay for coaching but no idea how that is accessed.  You are left on your own devices to navigate through.  As clearly this did will not fit my lifestyle and I‚Äôll return to using my Cooking Light Diet app, from the previously a forenamed magazine, I wrote to customer service to cancel my membership, which should include refunding everything I purchased under any legitimate consumer protection law.  The response I received is my membership was cancelled, thank-you, but to enjoy using the app till 3 months into the future.  That was the straw that broke the camel‚Äôs back.  Yes it included some links to some help desk pages, but those do not resolve my concerns or make it useable for me.    Much clearer transparency should be provided in their marketing materials.  I‚Äôm sure this works for some, but my guess not many because of how complicated it is.  Buyer beware.  I don‚Äôt even believe not refunding me what I‚Äôve paid within an hour of buying is even within consumer protection laws in the state of WA.

Content: The only reason I downloaded this app was because it appeared free in the App Store.  When I entered age, weight etc it wanted to connect to Facebook and showed different subscription options. I figured it‚Äôs one of many apps that one can download free, but after a couple workouts it would say ‚Äúto continue‚Äù please subscribe. I did not want to pay for any subscription, there are plenty truly free and much better resources out there. I did not subscribe, looked through the app, wasn‚Äôt impressed, never used once and forgot all about it.  A week later a charge of 57$+ dollars showed up on my credit card. I monitor daily. I wanted to call credit card company to report fraudulent transaction, but decided to log into my account first to see if it would show what is the charge for.   Turned out it‚Äôs subscription for this App kicked in. Apparently by downloading free app, you are actually subscribing to 7 day free trial ( free indeed) and then automatically are subscribed for 6 month plan with the app and your card is charged. Unless you cancel within 7 days. It wasn‚Äôt specified anywhere. I thought this app was just like all the other apps out there that either expire after trial period or prompt you to subscribe if you want to continue using. NO other app ever charged me without prompting to choose and agree to subscription. Very shady. Also, they have different tiers: 9.99 per month, 6.99 for some other period- many options. I, of course, was automatically subscribed to the most expensive ‚Äúpremium‚Äù ( whatever that means) version.   Overall, unethical business practices aside, this app isn‚Äôt worth it even if it was free. Recipes are basic, you don‚Äôt need an app to tell you to take chicken breast and peppers, put them in the pan and cook until ready. Laughable. Workouts worth 28 days. Subscription is for 6 months, not sure why would I need subscription for so long when workouts end after less than a month.

Content: I was excited to get to use this app to help me be more consistent with intermittent fasting. Like some other reviews here, I had many issues with the timer. When you forgot to set it or start it, there was no was to manually adjust it so that it would be correct. Also, as far as adjustments go, i couldn't ever find a way to adjust any goals; I only had to use the goals they set according to my quiz results. For instance, the water tracker feature set my goal at 3.2L, but my actual goal is 9L lol. While I could continue to add to my water intake, it was just one more frustration with the app.   For meal planning, they had a really great variety of vegan foods that I was super excited about trying. However, every single meal and snack was different. For someone that's busy, I can't cook up that much food in advance. And there's no grocery list to help you out there either. I certainly don't have time to sit down and write out recipes for 28 different dishes a week!!!   When I emailed them my concerns on separate occasions for separate issues, they never responded to my emails...at all! I would say the customer service was bad but it was nonexistent. By far the worst money I've ever tried on a new app. Don't use it.  UPDATE: customer service did respond and gave me a full refund. However, they only responded to me AFTER I left this terrible review. And they've continued to hound me to change my review...which in my mind is terrible customer support. Thanks for the money back I guess.
