Content: Downloaded app from Instagram.  And vaguely remember being asked to login on the website.     Videos were not for me.   I can‚Äôt pinpoint what it was since it was back in May but I did cancel on app. And deleted.   Didn‚Äôt catch the first charge.  But catch the second 53.04 charge 6 months later.  When I called Felix informed me that since I logged into the website that I had needed to cancel on the website. After a bit he said he could refund me the latest withdrawal. Why not both.   I never used the app to begin with so the 25.99 to ‚Äútry‚Äù it should also be returned as well.  Very shady business. It‚Äôs unfortunate that knowing who a majority of users this business has, they choose to exploit it.
Title: Very sneaky on cancellations

Content: First, the scare tactics of losing access to the coupon code are so 1990‚Äôs (especially when you just send out even deeper discounts the next day).   Second, make sure the coupons actually work OR freaking respond when someone asks for help purchasing. I‚Äôve waited a week, placed two help tickets, and still no response!  Third, using a scare tactic ‚Äúyour goal is impossible‚Ä¶ without our app‚Äù via a fake trainer, is beyond icky!   And it‚Äôs clearly fake when my goal is to lose two pounds/get tone, and I‚Äôm not even going for ‚Äúweight loss‚Äù but doing your somatic trainings, but you require weight loss rather than the including a weight gain or maintain as an option.   You‚Äôre staff think I can‚Äôt lose two pounds without investing in this app?! Seriously? Any trainer worth their salt would tell me to gain muscle!   This email made me go ‚Äúnope! Don‚Äôt want ANYTHING to do with these guys! No wonder they are hitting ads so heavy, they can‚Äôt create organic clientele if this is their ethos‚Äù
Title: Scammy and Unprofessional

The ‚Äúclasses‚Äù are so short you don‚Äôt feel like you did enough and I couldn‚Äôt do multiple days in a row. It‚Äôs more of a calorie count with meals and water count. I was bummed. Title: This app is a money scam! Don‚Äôt use it!!!

Content: I purchased BetterMe annual subscription recently ($29.99) and was disappointed to find out that it costs a whole lot more to get any coaching tips or to participate in any of the in-app fitness challenges, on top of the annual subscription fee. You basically get the same features in this app that you get for free on the basic Fitbit app. BetterMe does not sync with Fitbit, by the way, so your Fitbit steps don‚Äôt get logged. A week after I subscribed to BetterMe, I got logged out of my account somehow and the app no longer recognizes my email address so I can‚Äôt reset my password or log back in. I contacted BetterMe‚Äôs customer support and still, a whole week later, have not received a response. Don‚Äôt waste your money subscribing to this app. The only pro I can think of for this app is that it reminds you when to begin and end your fast, but you can easily do that by setting a reminder on your phone. I hope my review is helpful.
Title: Bait and switch app, terrible customer service

Content: After the daily workout (1 set for 10 mins), if you want to continue, the exercises are poorly done. Not to mention, this workout is not cheap as well. I expect more than that for the price I paid. So many additional fees to unlock some services. Please go to Youtube instead, lots in there and it‚Äôs free. Ridiculous App!!!

Or you could find challenges for free on YouTube. The app is designed well, but it is not actually designed for accountability, so if you‚Äôre someone who needs that, don‚Äôt bother with this program. It congratulates you daily for challenges you decide are a waste of time and quit, and it does this for the full 30 days. I tried several of the workouts and found the flow was awkward. From standing to floor to standing to all fours (things like that could be in the middle), which some could argue is part of the exercise except you‚Äôre doing this for so little time it‚Äôs just a waste and just why?

Content: Update: NOTHING IS BEING DONE! Tonight this app tried to charge me 10 times in less than 2 mins. I have screenshots. I got a bogus (probably Auto-bot) apology. And a convoluted, web of confusion explanation from someone named Bruce. I was assured it would not try to charge me anymore, but alas tonight it tried to hit me 10 times. STAY AWAY FRON THIS APP!  Absolute rip off, with no recourse. I canceled the free trial in plenty of time because none of the plans made since. What a freaking hassle!!! There is no phone number, no live chat, no way to get this resolved. And Apple is merely a third party. This is a money grabber. STAY AWAY!!!!!!!

Title: cancel all

Content: After several cordial email conversations with the marketing team, I am updating my 1 star to 3 stars. I was instructed how to turn off auto-renewal, have done that and then cancelled the account, and have received a partial refund.  I am thankful to have been heard and for the response. Everyone please know I have learned my lesson and will ho back to my normal rule of never responding to an unsolicited marketing ad. Thankful for the lesson and for the fair result.   Update after Developer Response 060123. Thank you for your response. In the email I received today, your rep stated that users are warned before automatic charges take place. I received no such warning. The only communication I received from BetterMe was AFTER the charge for the full price renewal was made. I communicated with you immediately after receiving that first communication. After the communication from you today, my request for refund and my frustration with your lack of consideration for your clients is totally justified. My prayer is that other FaceBook potential customers will do what I failed to do, which is to check negative reviews before responding to your ads. Good customer service promotes good customer loyalty. You have an opportunity here to demonstrate that kind of good customer service. I am still‚Ä¶ Greatly Disappointed. Update after Developer response 052923. Thank you for your response. I have 3 Case IDs, 4828898, 4796698, 4793040. I alerted you to cancel the charge for an additional term on the day you alerted me of the charge. There was no courtesy message beforehand which is typical on other accounts. I have cancelled the account via the App. It would be great and typical good customer service for you to refund the charge as requested. I prefer to continue the conversation with you in this forum, but would also like confirmation of the refund and the deleting of my credit card info from your records via email as I have previously requested. Thank you. I saw BetterMe in a FaceBook ad some time ago. The ad said the app was on sale for 50% off. I do not normally reply to FB ads but was wanting help with my walking program. I have since moved on from the app and have deleted it. I was surprised this weekend to receive an international auto charge on my credit card for another 90 days of ‚Äúfull subscription‚Äù price. There was no warning or opportunity to decide or decline, just a confirmation auto-email. I have replied with a request to confirm cancellation and to request a refund. I also clicked on Support and Billing buttons to register my complaint. I have heard from no one. Please be aware. I had to reinstall the app b/c apparently that is the only way to cancel auto-pay. I am concerned that other reviewers say that charges have continued. It would be great to hear from someone at BetterMe.

Title: Frustrated

Content: *EDITED WARNING* when the company responds, they are GASLIGHTING. I wish so badly I could add screenshots to this review!! Guys, I don‚Äôt ever write bad reviews because it makes me feel bad for the company but this is horrible! Read the latest reviews and stay away!  I was on the subscription page, past the part where I give info about myself, my body, my metabolism etc., and I minimized the app so I could check some things before going through with the payment of $20. I then got a notification from the app saying ‚Äúlimited offer.‚Äù Didn‚Äôt think anything of that, but pulled the app payment screen back up again and there was a pop-up there claiming I could now get it for $9.99, 50% off, one-time offer. I decide that I don‚Äôt want to pass that up and pay the $9.99. Then I find out it was 50% off of health coaching that I did not want (I have a screenshot of the original 50% offer that expresses nowhere that the offer is for something else other than what I thought I was paying for - very misleading). So I have to pay full $20 for the program I was interested in to begin with, on top of the $9.99 they slyly played me for. I‚Äôll go to YouTube before I do apps like this. Content: I bought the app on a impulse and was intrigued by the simpleworkouts I could do from home If I missed going to my training session that day. Title: FRAUD

Title: Scam

Content: A few months ago, I‚Äôve purchased 3 months of trial for this app. I did not have time to use it, so I cancelled during the second month. When I checked  the account in the app, it was saying ‚ÄúPersonalized Plan We've canceled your subscription, and you will not be charged in the future You can still access all of BetterMe until your current subscription ends‚Äù.   This morning, they tried to draw money out of the account. When I reached out, they explained that usually there would be additional steps to take to cancel the account (I checked the app and there was nothing; I searched for e-mails from them, nothing). Also they said that I might‚Äôve signed on for something else after cancelling the membership. I did not.  Moreover, there is no program/membership active on the account. Plus, I would‚Äôve remembered if I signed up for something; leave alone that I add events in my calendar when the payments are due when I join things like this, just to make sure that I have money available in that account.   They ‚Äúcancelled‚Äù my membership this morning, but they won‚Äôt stop the payment that they charged without my permission. This is plain and simple theft.   Update:  After several e-mails back and forth this is what I received back.    ‚Äú Hello! Thank you for your response. Your satisfaction with our services means a lot to us. We have issued a refund for your charge in the amount of 53.04 USD. Just to let you know, the refund process usually takes 5-10 business days depending on the case. If you have any further questions, we will be glad to help. You can contact us at any time. Christina Billing Manager‚Äù   Bottom line, they are giving me the money back in 10 days and I am supposed to be happy even though they had no right to take these money.   Horrible experience!
Title: They got money out of my account AFTER I Cancelled

Content: First initial charge to keep going is just for a (fasting) timer. Meal plan is another separate charge you have to buy. Watch YouTube videos and make your own meal plans. It‚Äôll be cheaper.
Title: Not as advertised.

Content: I was under the impression upon signing up that I would get a specific workout routine and meal plan built just for me. Title: Not in my Apple Apps Subscriptions Panel

Content: Y‚Äôall, I never wrote review for an app, but I feel like I have to. It did help me loose weight. It‚Äôs like having multiple apps for tracking calories, intermittent fasting, steps, exercise, water tracker, etc in one place. And you do want to hit that every green check mark by the end of the day. You kinda become addicted to it. I was 142.4 at the start (1/22/23) - not a lot to start with, but now it‚Äôs 3/4/23 and I‚Äôm 131.4 - almost at my weight goal. Now, I used their suggested routine as a template, but on most days I did more than was required by plan: suggested calories were around 1600 a day, I tried to stay under 1000. Suggested calorie burn was around 550 a day, I tried to go above 1000. Do drink that water. Stay focused and you‚Äôll get there. I‚Äôve been trying to loose these freaking 15 pounds for years. Also, my fellow females, be aware that during PMS you most likely will gain weight out of thin air and it‚Äôs extremely frustrating. On those days I just wanted to give up‚Ä¶ just don‚Äôt check your weight during that period and you‚Äôll be ok :) The app does have a few bugs (the most frustrating was when daily educational stories got stuck on chapter 9 and never moved on from there - I liked reading those, while they lasted‚Ä¶)

Additionally, the first few ‚Äúencouraging‚Äù articles ask for some things that could be really concerning such as asking you to rate your body‚Äôs features on a scale of 1-10. These articles and such can‚Äôt be turned off. Anyone looking for a healthy relationship with food/exercise/body image should probably not download this app

Content: TL/DR: not worth the money. Get MyFitnessPal instead  I have been very successful in a ketogenic diet, but I wanted something to take me to the next level. Here are my issues:  1. There is no way to change the micros to a keto diet even though they offer meals and recipes for keto. Why log my calories if you say I‚Äôm over my fat content constantly?  2. No communication happened even though I emailed and sent messages/help requests in the app itself.  3. The meals rely too heavily on salads instead of other vegetables for greens.  4. For an app like this, you should not be forced to pay $15 just to see what it‚Äôs like. I feel a bit like I was tricked into spending money.  5. You can get everything you get from this app (and way better in my opinion) by simply using MyFitnessPal to log meals. If you really need a meal plan, I‚Äôd recommend reaching out to someone rather than using theirs.  6. As for the workouts, I‚Äôve found YouTube to have just as good of exercises.

Title: Next Exercise

Content: I have recently been injured resulting in a disability. I downloaded BetterMe to help assist me in coping with depression as well as ideas for exercises and stretches that I am currently able to do. I entered the free trial looking to see if the full version of the app had answers that the trial did not.   I deleted my account since I couldn‚Äôt benefit from this app, however I was still charged $42.84. I contacted the customer service team, explaining this, and did not receive an answer as to why I was still charged, just a confirmation that my account was indeed deleted.   Days after I FINALLY received a refund, I was charged a SECOND time. I was not given a receipt, a notification of the charge, just a notice from my PayPal account that it happened. This was bad business to begin with and now has gone completely into shady territory.
Title: THEFT. DO NOT DOWNLOAD.

Content: I bought this and was doing good but I stopped using after vacation. Anyways, I cancelled my subscription in October before it was to renew in November. Because this was under my PayPal they still took my 29.99$ fee for the 3 months, trying to get my money back they took another 42.84$. Bad company, taking money out of my account unauthorized.
Title: Bad Company

Content: Beware! I have been charged 19.99 for and annual renewal and now a 29.99 charge as a new account even though I alerted them to this problem before the 7 day trial period on the date of the 29.99 subscription.  I have requested the 29.99 be refunded. They offered me a longer membership by combining the charges which i responded ‚Äúno thanks‚Äù  So now the charges are both on my credit card and paypal  I‚Äôve asked again for them to correct this and so far‚Ä¶ CRICKETS! üò°
Title: Duplicate charges

Content: Be careful with this App. I purchased the weekly plan to try out but without any notifications, I was renewed into a monthly plan. I contacted the App immediately on the day they charged me for a monthly plan, and expressed that I had no intention to get a monthly plan at all, but they refused to refund the charge but offered one more month for free. If I didn't feel the App is useful, why do I want another month even if it is free? Well, in the end, on the day they charged me, and on the same day I emailed to explain I didn't want to have the monthly plan, but, they still charged me for one month. Exactly the same day!  Take the $28.56, but you lost your business dignity.
Title: Purchased one week to try, but was automatically renewed to monthly

Content: Unless you have all the time in the world to manage these kind of apps beware. Though it‚Äôs not technically a scam, they got me for a few hundred dollars for zero services rendered. I agreed to pay $29.99 for three months because I thought I‚Äôd try it and see if it did anything for me. I got as far as downloading the app and forgot about it because the name of the app was not the same as what I had clicked on to buy it so I overlooked it on my phone. And, of course, you guessed it, the small print came in to play and I just realized that they‚Äôve been billing me $60/mo automatically through PayPal. I‚Äôve never even open the app, so I called them to disconnect from blood-sucking my bank account and ask for a refund but they explain that they don‚Äôt care whether I use or even open the app. They‚Äôre not refunding a dime. Sure, you can say it‚Äôs 100% my responsibility to read all the legalese‚Äîthere‚Äôs no way I would‚Äôve signed up for $60 a month for this stupid app if they would‚Äôve made the cost clear but they are very careful in how they write their hook so that that‚Äôs not made clear. In my book, that‚Äôs shady.
Title: beware

Content: These walk workouts are such an insane waste of money!!!!! Do not waste your money!!!!! Find it on YouTube
Title: Horrible

Content: I just joined.I have lots of questions but I can‚Äôt seem to get any answers for eight hours. This program is much too complicated so far.Why do I need a nickname? They‚Äôre all taken so I don‚Äôt know what to use. Should I pick a name that has nothing to do with me?
Title: Too complicated

Content: This app is amazing.  6 weeks in, 6 pounds lost.  Love that I can play my Spotify tunes under the video work outs!  Video workouts are a huge library - plenty of options to keep me moving.  Love the motivation it gives me to see my progress through data & really love how easy the food tracker is to use.  Wish they had better connections between iPad and iPhone apps (workouts on iPad don‚Äôt communicate to daily tracker stats on iPhone).  Still 5 stars, because it‚Äôs great overall!
Title: It Works, if You do the work!

Content: I saw app on Instagram. Decided to try their introductory offer of 19.99. I check my account and was double charged. 19.99x2. Apparently when I opened app first time they pop up all these other option windows. I touched something not knowing they were charging me again. Seems pretty sneaking to me. I‚Äôd be careful opening app and new windows popping up. For this unethical reason I am canceling this one week after I downloaded it. I doubt I‚Äôll even get my $$ back. Always some company trying to take advantage of people these days.
Title: double charged from the beginning

Content: I have sent two emails to support requesting a refund of my yearly amount of $59.99. As of yet I have received no correspondence regarding this request. Your app does not sync with my Fitbit and I could not find two of the workouts that were advertised on Facebook. When I wrote an email to you I did not receive a sufficient answer to my question regarding the workouts. Therefore I would like a refund to my account.  Jacque Burrow
Title: Refund

Content: Horrible start!  They charged me twice and now won‚Äôt let me in the app until I subscribe again for $19.99?  How will I get in to cancel it?? What a racket. Feel like I‚Äôve been robbed.
Title: Double charge

Content: I would like Yoga for Seniors program. Why can I not find it on your website. Please advise.
Title: DL2575575

Content: Totally poor business model, terrible interface.  I wanted to try the workouts for a month, compare them to videos I can get on YouTube free, and find out if a tracking app plus work outs was a good fit for me. After too many ads, I get the signup, cheapest month $19.99. Ok. Too expensive. But I‚Äôm in it to see how it would work for me.  I get the app on my phone and try logging in but am now deluged with ads for diet plans and because it covers the close window X, I was left with the impression maybe my subscription didn‚Äôt go through because the price was the same. So I click accept. My bad you could say, but I figured within two hours of initial purchase I could cancel so I emailed developer. Nope. But I did get more ads!
Title: Misleading interface, Aggressive marketing

Content: Kicked my butt on the first workout but I modified as needed and did it!!
Title: BetterMe

Content: i love this app, it‚Äôs so helpful.. although i am having trouble accessing the calorie tracker it only lets me when it pops up for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Which is fine but i like to log in my calories immediately so i won‚Äôt forget. I tried clicking the plan to access it their which didn‚Äôt work. I also tried clicking the app and pressed log in calories which brought me to a screen which had the plan 12.99 a month. I just would like to know how to access or is it not free anymore, please reach out to me asap. Thank you .
Title: calorie tracker ??

Content: I uploaded the app looked at it and never opened it even ones after. But it was a few charges on my card. I‚Äôm very angry because I didn‚Äôt sign for $28.56 membership or bought some products/services from it , and I was charged 3 times. Even if I clicked something - it was probably some kind of hidden agreement, that I wouldn‚Äôt sign if I‚Äôd see the price (which is super high for this type of app). I hate when apps are traps like this!
Title: Unauthorized payments

Content: This app will ask you a bunch of questions and will build a plan for you. You will be limited to only what is included in the plan and everything extra would be for an extra cost. Plan that was built for me based on my 50+ age is totally off. It does not come even close to give me any challenge, not to say to help me to improve. Any attempt to work with support gave me just blah-blah and never dream to get a refund. I think everyone could be better off doing various instructor lead workouts on YouTube which are free and available for preview. You can build your own workout ‚Äúlibrary‚Äù of what you like and what works for you.
Title: Think twice when try

Content: I signed up for 7 day free trial and when I was clicking around the app to see their class offerings, I guess I clicked on a class that was a premiere offering. I didn‚Äôt know. By me clicking on that class or activity, it charged me the $14.99 a month. So I was charged $1 then $14.99 during this 7 day free trial. It is super misleading and tricky.
Title: BEWARE!!! Was charged $1 and $14.99 during ‚Äúfree trial‚Äù

Content: I am not happy with this 29.00 and I can‚Äôt get into the program.  I would like a refund but have not been able to get through.
Title: betterme

Content: Paid 19.99 for a subscription that I never got access to.
Title: Seems like a Scam

Content: I never review apps but this time I am.  I want to warn anyone considering subscribing to this service.  I agreed to a trail subscription and tried it for one day.  Then next time I tried to open the app it asked me to create an account again.  It wasn‚Äôt that useful so I uninstalled the app.  I checked my subscription list on my Apple account and the service was NOT in my list of active subscriptions so I thought that was the end of it.    Today, I downloaded the last month of my bank activity to reconciliation my records and found that BetterMe charged my bank account $169.91 in less than a month.  I went to their website and completed a chat request expecting to chat with a person.  Instead I received a message saying they would be in contact shortly.  The BetterMe charges DO NOT show in my Apple purchase or subscription history so how do they have my debit card number?  Next I‚Äôm filing a complaint with my bank and I can only hope I can get the money back.
Title: This app is a scam - DO NOT AGREE TO SUBSCRIPTION

Content: Update: still won‚Äôt response or answer a call. No response to email. Just take my money and keep taking it, you FPOS. Horrible app, horrible company and the worst workout product app you can waste you money in. We‚Äôre now 4 over charges, one every 3 months for a WHOLE year! Thanks guys! You need my money more than family does in these hard times‚Ä¶.. still no reply from the company. Stay away, you can find all this same info on YouTube for free. UPDATE: Even after multiple requests to stop this worthless program and they keep charging me! Since they will not provide a cancellation number you can‚Äôt dispute the charges. Meanwhile I‚Äôm in over $100 in extra charges and can‚Äôt cancel. They are just literally stealing my money and laughing about it. The app has no features that are common sense. I am currently looking into a lawyer to try and get this to stop. But they don‚Äôt care, they just want your money‚Ä¶.. I am not very excited about paying $30 and then being asked everyday to add another $30 purchase to my plan. I signed up thinking it was an all in one but it doesn‚Äôt appear that‚Äôs the case. I can get all the same stuff this app provides for $30 for free with other apps and YouTube.
Title: Stop Asking Me To Buy More Stuff

Content: Wrote a review‚Ä¶ they deleted it. This app is not user friendly. The calorie counter is incredibly frustrating as it only allows you to enter in oz or service sizes. The bar code scanner glitches out making it mostly unusable and the app doesn‚Äôt remember the foods you have logged so you have to re enter then into the search bar and find them. Save your money and join myfitness pal .
Title: They deleted my review ‚Ä¶ great

Content: Do not, under any circumstances, start using this fitness assistant. The app is actually very problematic and not at all worth the money it asks for to access it.The worst thing here is that there is no trial version and yet they don't give you a refund. I paid for the subscription without worrying about not liking the app. After all, I knew there was a refund.As it turns out, I was cheated. 1 star.
Title: I lied about the availability of a refund

Content: I owe it to you to warn you that this app is made by scammers. They lie everywhere, using even the meanest and dirtiest techniques. Today, a person from this company emailed me and offered me a deal.He promised me money in exchange for my removing my own negative feedback.I, in turn, promised myself not to trust this app.
Title: Paying to remove bad reviews

Content: This app is the weakest part of the customer support service.Its employees do not know anything at all and are not able to adequately advise.I am extremely resentful of their work. I have contacted them many times and have never received any help.In addition, they are boorish and extremely uncaring towards customers.I couldn't have imagined such a level of service. What a nightmare!
Title: Terrible customer service.

Content: I think every iOS device user should know that this app withdraws money from the card without asking.I ask everyone to ignore this product and walk past it. The developers purposely arranged their subscription so that it withdraws money without notification.That is, it connects to your account and can withdraw money without warning.This is the first time this has happened to me. I never got my money back. Disliked!
Title: Taking money without asking

Content: I used the bar code scanner to get precise calorie count of some quinoa and rice I was cooking from Costco package product.  Also, the app has my local eateries such as Salad n Go.  I‚Äôm really digging it!
Title: Best calorie tracker

Content: Hello who do I contact about owing money when I never used the app i Can‚Äôt update or download any apps because i owe this app 19.99 but I never used it downloaded it but never opened it really.  If there is anyone I can contact about this I greatly appreciate it thank you.  Kristina Cardinale
Title: Subscription never used

Content: You should know that once a subscription is activated, it's not that easy to disconnect it. The developers intentionally complicated this process to minimize the loss of customers.I think it's not a fair game at all. They simply don't let people leave and hold them hostage.I can't just delete the app because the subscription is connected to my card. To avoid having to pay every month, I must cancel my membership in the program.So it's best not to get involved.

Content: Did you know that there is no offline mode? Personally, I didn't! The developers decided that I did not need to know this.Why are you silent about such an important point? Fortunately, I learned about this defect almost immediately.But what's the point if they didn't give me my money back anyway? After all, my reason seemed a bit farfetched.In general, I am very unhappy that it was withheld from me. If I had known, I would not have even looked at this app.
Title: Only works online

Content: I'm just horrified by how this app works. Lots of faults, bugs and bugs.Worst of all, the communication with support is not done well either. So there is no one to even ask for help from. The problem with communication has caused me a lot of problems.The button on the website is not active at all. When I did manage to send a message to support, there was simply no response.I unmistakably disliked it.
Title: The communication button doesn't work

Content: There is no doubt that the creators of this app are crooks. They lie about absolutely everything.In the ads, they promised a trial version, which does not exist, or a money-back guarantee for the subscription.A lot of promised internal features have to be purchased separately. What the assistant advises is nonsense! Some of the advice is dangerous for your health.Be careful and treat it with caution.
Title: They distribute unverified information

Content: When I entered the menu, I was completely alone. I had no experience with programs like this before.So I contacted support, but they decided not to answer me.So I got to know and explore the app on my own, completely on my own.A couple of times, I still waited for the operators to answer, but I want to note that the workers are not competent.I think they knew their program better than I did. In general, I do not recommend it.
Title: No customer care

Content: Who created these horrible meal plans? I seriously wonder how the process of writing the diets went.I'm more than sure that there were people involved who knew nothing about it at all.I think the developers decided to save money on normal nutritionists and hired someone off the street.Tips are unworkable and rather dangerous to human health. Come to your senses, refuse the advice of this assistant.
Title: Horrible meal plans

Content: You should be careful when purchasing access to this service. You run the risk of paying for something other than what you expected from this fitness assistant.The developers deceived me and, after entering the menu, I did not find some of the features that were promised.More precisely, they were not available and you had to pay to unlock them. I was very indignant at this point, so I demanded a refund. But to no avail, no result.
Title: Hidden Costs

Content: I am very unhappy to be a customer of this service. Its quality of service leaves a lot to be desired.I also resent the greed of the developers who decided to save money by creating an offline mode.Is it really that expensive and complicated? Your app doesn't depend on the Internet at all!In general, I still don't understand a lot of things. I don't use the app anymore.
Title: No offline mode

Content: Be prepared to be cheated here. Trust me, the developers will find a way to do this.A friend of mine didn't want to help him cancel his subscription. He was cheekily charged every month.They treated me differently. I just didn't know how the subscription worked. I deleted the app and forgot about it. Then I saw that I had been chargedand without any messages or warnings. I wouldn't recommend this service to anyone.
Title: Subscriptions are renewed without asking

Content: I assure you that the app is not worth the price you pay for it. Don't be in a hurry to sign up for a subscription.For me personally, the biggest problem was disabling the subscription.You can't leave it alone because it automatically charges you for its renewal.And support operators purposely don't want to help you quit, because that's how they lose money. Title: There is no function to disable a subscription

Content: It's hard to believe the things the developers of this app allow themselves.I left a negative comment about the assistant after I stopped using it.Literally the next day, I got an email from someone who supports the app with an extraordinary request.Namely, remove the review I left earlier for a fee. Be careful, they will cheat you using every possible method to do that.
Title: I was asked to delete comments

Content: Not only is the app paid for, but after the payment it turned out that it is not finalized.The training workouts are made by as green as grass gentlemen. It is particularly confusing and this is not the only case. Why should I pay for it? I hope you fix it,
Title: misleading advertisements

Content: The ad on Fb said couch yoga.  I signed up. Better me immediately subscribed me to coaching for 19.99 a year.  I couldn‚Äôt click past it.  I‚Äôve yet to find the couch yoga.  Which is what I signed up for.
Title: Yoga

Content: I purchased this in January without really looking at the reviews. I should have. I never write reviews that aren‚Äôt positive in nature, but I feel compelled to share my experience with this app. Hopefully this feedback will help them to come up with a real solution.  I‚Äôve been back and forth with this app‚Äôs customer service team multiple times over the past few months. Once about every 28-30 days to be exact. It seems that the app doesn‚Äôt have the space to hold data for longer than that amount of time. It begins to double up the information you‚Äôve logged.  Not only that, you actually have to log something new in order to be able to delete the old information out. If you attempt to delete the information first, the app will freeze and you‚Äôre forced to close out the app and begin again.  Their solve is for you to keep uninstalling and reinstalling the app every 28-30 days. You lose all of your data/progress info, and have to start everything over again.  At first, I thought it was just something on my end, but after doing this twice and reading some of the other reviews, I realized this was not an issue only I was having. Again, it seems there is only enough space for a certain amount of data before the app begins to malfunction.  During this last communication with the customer service team, they tried to tell me they could see that I hadn‚Äôt uninstalled and reinstalled the app (which I did do multiples times) in an attempt to get me to go through the same nonsense of uninstalling and reinstalling again.  I finally asked for a refund and was directed to speak with Apple because they can‚Äôt help me with that.  It‚Äôs already hard enough to have to be diligent about logging something into an app to try and track what‚Äôs going on with your health. The tracker itself shouldn‚Äôt be this difficult to use.  You can honestly do this for free in MyFitnessPal and it will track forever. I got sucked in by the exercise options, but once I signed up realized they weren‚Äôt the best either and went back to YouTube - also free.  Idk. If you find something you really have to have in this app, go for it, but I have yet to figure out what‚Äôs so great about it. And I‚Äôve been trying to use it and patiently work with customer service for almost 3 1/2 months.
Title: If you‚Äôre looking for something to be frustrated about regularly, buy this app.

Content: I found this app on the internet and decided to try it after reading an article in their website, which I thought was what the app was about. There was no way of knowing what to expect until after purchase. Then I spent an extra $29.99 for what I thought was what I wanted. Still not what I was looking for. Now I am out over $60 and they won‚Äôt refund me. Don‚Äôt do it. It‚Äôs not a good idea.
Title: Not as expected

Content: I would like to warn all users of IOS devices about the lies spread by this service regarding its functionality.After buying a login, you will be able to use only a small part of the features promised in the ads.Many of the features aren't there at all, some are bad or don't work at all.To be honest with you, I was surprised at the amount of activity that the representatives of this product allowed themselves.You cannot allow such a lie to go unpunished.
Title: Lies about service

Content: You advertised as chair yoga on Instagram. This program is everything but chair yoga.Please refund my money, this program not for me.
Title: Not able to do

Content: I make my own food I am a vegan and your program is really not what I expected. I walk 3x per day I usually walk 8000-9500 steps per day. I‚Äôm sorry I don‚Äôt know what I expected but not this.
Title: I made a mistake

Content: It‚Äôs pretty good BUT I was doing a workout and it said sweat it‚Äôs just fat crying what if I‚Äôm sweaty all the time are you calling me fat my guy. (Jk it‚Äôs a great app the workout did say that but I just thought it would be funny to say that) 100000000/10 recommend.
Title: üò≠

Content: I want to complain about this fitness assistant because of the false information it spreads about itself.There is not a great range of services as advertised.I asked the App Store management to look into the activities of this app.I think this is not a mistake at all, but a brazen lie on the part of the developers.Think twice before buying a subscription.
Title: Not what they promised

Content: I filled out for a trial period, then I deleted the app after I looked at the reviews and as I was trying to navigate the app, it became frozen every time. I then see that 19.00 was removed from my checking account. Where is the trial period? Where is your subscription on my phone?  Only contact by text? This is a scam, I want my 19.00 back ASAP. You all should be ashamed .
Title: Scam

Content: This app was not useful to me. I was charged $42.00 (double the amount I originally agree to) for a renewal of subscription that I did not want. They refused to refund me. I would not recommend.
Title: Disappointed!

Content: I wanted a good fitness and diet app hoping this was the one. I was under the impression that my subscription would be 59 for 6 months but was charged 83.00. They tried to fix it with giving me an additional 6 months which was cool but the I‚Äôm on the second day of the app and I‚Äôm still not seeing where it was worth 59 dollars let alone 83. I cant see my stats. All my linked devices are showing different data. I‚Äôm disappointed and would like a refund but do to the policy I believe I am out of 83.00. Wish i knew what I know now I would had not waisted my time. The only good thing is the workouts and even the inspiration messages but the app is unfortunately a glitch.
Title: Could be better

Content: I paid the $29.99 subscription fee for the app, which resulted in zero changes in my app for me. I contacted customer service, let them know what happened. They tried to help, it didn‚Äôt work, so I asked for my money back. Customer service offered to extend my subscription instead of giving me my money back. Once I told them no, they stopped responding to me. The app won‚Äôt even let me refresh the conversation or send them anything else. It feels like I got scammed. I want my money back. I truly hope I get a response, because the next step is the Better Business Bureau.
Title: Feels like I got scammed

Content: Where to start? First there are the exercise sets. I joined this based on its advertisement that it was Pilates. There are several supposed Pilates exercise videos but in fact they are highly repetitive, a 20 minute session consisting largely of three types of exercises repeated multiple times. They are not traditional Pilates exercises either. Then there is the calorie counter which is literally impossible. As an example they list two different values for 4 ounces of chicken thighs; one is 160 cal, the other is 264 cal. Possibly they may be differences in whether they're boneless, skinless, or have some additions, however they do not give any further information than chicken thigh 4 ounces.Two different calorie counts for ostensibly the same thing? Really? This is not an isolated case. Another to type in coffee. That one will get you supposedly 80 cal for a 6.7 ounce cup of coffee. Probably it's supposed to include sugar and or milk but they don't say! You cannot find out what the components are and you cannot change it for different additions nor ounces,  even if it were the correct count. After one session with it, I canceled. My advice is not to subscribe.
Title: It is awful!

Content: The app itself is great. However they scam you into thinking you will be paying a very low price initially for the app. Then they tell you that you will be billed in a week at a discounted ‚Äú19.99‚Äù unless you cancel your subscription (which can take 3-5 days processing‚Ä¶)‚Äîthen they inform you the day of your renewal after the 7 days that you are getting charged 28$ (and they sent me the email ~after~ billing my account.)   What is not okay about this is that I explicitly had sent a message to the support team that I wanted to cancel before my 7 day trial and did not want to be billed/renewed for my subscription. They really quickly and kindly replied that they would cancel it and that I would not make any more payments.   Even though they said this I was billed. I have sent an email to them now to get my money back.   However I thought I would save people the trouble of even getting the app because it‚Äôs not worth it to go through the trouble of these payments. Seriously. Not worth it. Also they are very sneaky with their wording on the payments etc so It makes people easily confused. Just don‚Äôt do it. Lol.
Title: NOT 5 STARS: scam payments!!!!

Content: Similar to Noom but not as ‚Äúwordy‚Äù and cheaper! Food logging is terrible! Basic foods are hard to find or at the bottom of a list. Bar code scanner doesn‚Äôt always work. I really wish the food was easier to add, more common options were accessible and there were more editing options.
Title: Meh

Content: Do not use or recommend.  I canceled this program after I was unable to get to app after a day.  All the information, water intake, steps, days fasting etc. were gone.  I was asked to start over.  I ended the subscription via Apple and ITunes yet it continues to play in the background.  It will make my phone go into do not Disturb mode when I run a business.  I‚Äôm missing call, texts and emails.  Everyday I have to reset the settings.  Better me had also withdrawn all most $50.00 from my account without permission-and after I canceled.  They refuse to refund it!!!
Title: Flawed and will take funds

Content: Wish I could give this app a negative 10. They charged me the original $29.99 and then offered me an upgrade for $9.99. Instead they charged me an additional $39.99. So I paid $70 for this app. SO UNHAPPY!!  Updated: Customer service reached out and made it right. Very impressed with the customer service team.
Title: Horrible.....updated A+ customer service.

Content: The workouts are good and if your persistent the results will show, but the layout of the workouts is messy and the workouts are so repetitive. In the category working out at home you go right from a beginners full body hourglass workout to a no more flabby arm workout that‚Äôs advanced, which is followed by a beginners fully body burn workout. It would be better if you had all full body workouts together, then all the arms together, then all the butt workout, etc. I really appreciate the variety of workouts like home workouts, face yoga, wheelchair workouts, etc but because the workouts are so repetitive in one category it gets old quick. Something that really bothers me is the guided challenges  have the same reviews so someone who left a good review for the defined butt challenge somehow left the exact review word for word on every other challenge, leading you to never want to buy and participate in any of the challenges.
Title: Good at first but very repetitive

Content: Watch out for that second charge of $29.99..
Title: Fine print

Content: I‚Äôve been charged 19.99 4 times for nothing,I never went get started and didn‚Äôt think I was getting charged till 4 months later!
Title: Warning do not download

Content: I was charged 86.00 for a 2 month subscription and I DID NOT OK it.   I have not opened it once
Title: Beware

Content: The info is nothing you couldn‚Äôt get for free cruising the internet. They charge $4.99 initially, then guess what? You‚Äôre billed $14.99 for your ‚Äúsubscription.‚Äù Beware.
Title: This is a scam

Content: I took a 29.99 USD trial for 3 months assuming I could cancel after the first month if not satisfied. Well, I wish I could cancel after 1 week. During a week of faithful trial, it appears that this app is essentially a scam to get your money. The exercises and conception are overall poor compared to other online fitness, weight loss and diet health competitors. To access account after the first week, I had to take a 1 year subscription that I immediately cancelled. I wrote to BetterMe to explain the case and stop subscription entirely. All you get are these surreal answer that it is cancelled and will not be renews after the end of the subscription. It is not clear whether this is 3 month or 1 year since BetterMe will not reply. I am still hoping to hear from BetterMe for cancellation of all these subscriptions after 1st month.
Title: Poor app and lots of scamming

Content: This app offers an introductory rate of $14.99 , then the second month you‚Äôre forced to pay $28.   I cancelled my subscription in the app, but Better.me requires that you cancel subscriptions via the website having to contact customer support. There have been class action lawsuits for physical gyms for this level of predatory billing.  After some emails I was refunded my $28 payment but be warned that to cancel your subscription you must cancel through the website not just the app.  Based on the initial form letter I received, it‚Äôs obvious that customer support deals with this a lot and tries to keep half of your payment but with persistence you can get a full refund.
Title: Predatory billing practices

Content: I thought it was a one time purchase for $10.00. Turns out they are snagging 10$/ mo off my cc.
Title: Be careful

Content: I think this is a scam I did the trial and cancelled and they still charged me 89.00 and now that I‚Äôm trying to get my money back they don‚Äôt want to answer my messages and erased the my messages I sent them on there app to cancel so I would not recommend even bothering with this app a rip off.
Title: Not recommended

Content: I wanted to use this on all my Apple devices, including my desktop computer. The better.me app does not work on my desktop.   I‚Äôm happy to report the customer service team was very helpful and while I‚Äôm unable to properly assess the application, the better me team is doing great work.
Title: Customer Service team very responsive

Content: On Sept 30, 2020, by accident I clicked the button for the exercise & diet icon BetterMe. I canceled the subscription immediately. However, despite my immediate cancellation of BetterMe, the App took $29.99 from my Apple Cash. I attempted to get my refund but Apple Cash would not let me. It was a nightmare and literally impossible to get refund from Apple Cash. This is so bad and left a sour taste in my mouth. I am warning other user of Apple Cash. Do Not click any icon that showed up uninvited on your iPhone, especially BetterMe. It is a booby trap for Apple to take money out of your Apple Cash. There is absolutely no refund whatsoever. I feel robbed.
Title: Impossible to Obtain Refund when Accidentally purchased the App

Content: They will charge you full price for the next month if you don‚Äôt cancel on time. I didn‚Äôt read that I would be charged.  My fault I guess.  I alerted them ASAP.  They are still keeping my money.  To better me: Please note that I have deleted the app cuz I didn‚Äôt really like it.  But have fun with my $28.
Title: Beware of the one month trial   @19.99

Content: I didn‚Äôt use the app enough to justify the amount of $, so I went to cancel it. It was incredible difficult to do so and then I was charged $29.00 dollars twice in the same day  that I did not authorize üò° save yourself a headache  and find a more user friendly app.
Title: Terrible billing and canceling policy

Content: I indicated that I only had 30 minutes of prep time a day. Once I choose my meal plan, the prep time was 1.5 hours a day. So I just wasted $29.99.
Title: Misleading

Content: This app really got me to start exercising daily. With quarantine, it‚Äôs easy to have a whole day pass by with little to no movement but the push notifications and relatively easy work outs kept me motivated and in check.   I bought the year subscription but I don‚Äôt know if it was worth it. I started to question if the workouts were even working. I‚Äôve been doing Chloe ting challenges on youtube and find them more effective and challenging.   I like the water counter. The fasting feature is cool but needs work. I don‚Äôt always have my phone on me so sometimes I forget to hit fast and there is no way to adjust the time. The calorie counter is absolute trash.   I ended up buying one of the challenges to get back into the app but honestly? Totally not worth it. Nothing is actually personalized, you don‚Äôt get a real personal trainer. It‚Äôs basically the same as the subscription. I asked for my money back but have not heard back.   Overall, the app has lots of potential but falls short.
Title: Cant decide

Content: I have paid for 29.99 for a month, and realized it is a wrong subscription, they don‚Äôt allow cancellation.

Pass on this one, MYPlate is free and I‚Äôll keep using that, and do free workouts online
Title: Be careful!!! Tricks you into paying more

Content: This company will milk you for every penny. I purchased there meal plan. I understood I would received my meal plan through email Never received anything. Chalked it up to another FB scam. Identical to my purchase the month prior... I contacted customer service  They told me I could have 12 months at no additional charge or they would return $15.00 That‚Äôs $15.00 of the $60 they took without making it clear that it‚Äôs a monthly re occurring charge... These people are not worth dealing with.

Title: Fraudulent transactions

Content: I paid $29.99 and didnt last not even an hr on the app and i didnt like it and i wanted my refund back and just gave me back $14.99 this really upset me.
Title: Never again

Content: I signed up for a ‚Äúfree trial.‚Äù After spending less than 24 hours on the app, I contacted the company through the app and asked to cancel. After several days, I realized that it was never canceled and I was charged for the ‚Äúmembership.‚Äù Contacted them again to explain and the was told (a week later!) that ‚Äútheir hands were tied‚Äù because ‚ÄúWe do provide a free trial as well. It comes with a monthly package.‚Äù WHAT? So basically you get a free trial if you pay for a monthly package?? Doesn‚Äôt even make sense and defeats the whole purpose of a ‚Äúfree trial.‚Äù  I literally asked to cancel within 24 hours. I shouldn‚Äôt have to pay for a month. Such a scam.  If you‚Äôre still considering purchasing this app, I would highly discourage it. It‚Äôs basically dumb workout videos (which you could find for free on YouTube), a HORRIFIC food log/calorie tracker (several much better, free apps out there) and about 100 pop ups on your phone. I‚Äôd save my money.
Title: Total scam

Content: The actual app, workouts and meals are not bad however I canceled my subscription and still went months with being charged without knowing. It‚Äôs not labeled as a better me charge, it‚Äôs labeled as heathypay.com on my bank statements so I had to google it and found that other users were going through the same thing and that the site was linked to this app.   I finally emailed customer support and told them I‚Äôd like to cancel because I actually canceled it months ago. They went ahead and canceled it.  However they have sent me 2-3 emails requesting I tell them why I decided to cancel... very frustrating and the charges on my bank statements that were labeled differently were VERY misleading.  Be careful when making any subscription to this app. It‚Äôs not a simple cancellation process like you‚Äôd think.
Title: Charged even after canceling subscription

Content: Be prepared for constant requests to upgrade or pay for something else. I am reminded to eat breakfast in the middle of the day and asked if I want to upgrade to a new program.  I didn‚Äôt use this app at all. It was as if I paid (a lot) to have someone marketing their service to me all day. I sent a message asking to cancel my service and they tried to sell me something else by offering me a better deal. They take their marketing plan straight from the Timeshare companies.  The. Today I opened my bank statement and see that they withdrew two payments totaling $29.98 on the very day that I was told they would cancel my service. Ridiculous. Stay away.
Title: Non stop soliciting

Content: ‚ÄúBetter Me‚Äù has an add on application/website which is called ‚ÄúEat-Fit-Mealplan.com.‚Äù You cancel the ‚ÄúBetter Me‚Äù subscription, your money will still be deducted from your account through Eat-Fit-Mealplan.com.  When you realize that Eat-Fit-Mealplan.com, has been deducting money from your bank account, and you wanna see what is this app, and you search it in apple store, the result App Store gives you is ‚ÄúBetter Me‚Äù.   I am not sure why people are so satisfied with this app. It did not even work on my phone. Their website is very poor. Wishing the first glance you should smell something is fishy.
Title: Kind of Scam

Title: Money was debited, but the application is not available

Content: I purchased the Annual App for $29.99 after about a week or so after trying the App because I didn‚Äôt have full access to everything it had to offer.  After purchasing the Annual App, I still had the same limited access that you get when you use the App for free. So, I contacted their Customer Support which by the way is the only way you can contact them. They are in the Ukraine (Red Flag!!) The first and only response, after many emails I sent there after was that I needed to give them details as to what was going on. Which I stated everything in detail when they wrote me back. So, I‚Äôm guessing it was just a standard copied email replying to mine?? Not sure?? However, at the bottom of the email it says to reply with anything further to that email. Which I did reply back, and decided to send pictures too and stated in great detail what happened and wanted to have them fix it at the time. Waited a few days for a response, which it states in their email that will contact you within 24hrs. Not the case here. In fact, I have sent multiple emails since October 2020 and have yet to hear back. I gave them the benefit of the doubt since I figured just busy or overwhelming clients. By the time I had, had enough and asked for a refund through Apple it was too late. Apple told me I had to get my refund through them. Didn‚Äôt know there was a time frame for that kind of thing? Have yet to get any responses back from Better Me. DO NOT BUY THE APP!! If you do and are not satisfied, do not go through them, go through APPLE right away! Wish I had known that sooner before I lost my money because I‚Äôm sure they will never respond back to me or refund my Money!! Disappointed!!

Title: terrible.

Content: Update:   Customer service reached out to me and gave me a full refund.   It seems they were experiencing unusually high volumes.  I‚Äôm changing my review from 1 to 4 stars.   I think the goal and content was good.   The meal planning could use some work.   Be sure to read the site carefully before you purchase.  It just wasn‚Äôt the right product for me.  I could see it could work well for others.   I signed up for this through my work who provided us a discount.  The cost was supposed to be $20 for semi annual subscription.   When I checked out from the app it did not show a total and I was charged $39.99 for six month subscription +$29.99 for a sign up offer.    I did not get this email confirmation until after I looked at the app.  One of the main features I wanted to use was the meal planning I like the idea of having my meals planned and a shopping list do you have everything laid out for me.   It was completely useless the shopping list did not provide quantities so you would have to go through every recipe to find out how much of everything you needed add it all up to go shopping.  This is way too time-consuming for some thing I‚Äôm paying for.     I contacted customer service and they were very responsive but claimed they couldn‚Äôt find my account which is understandable I use my work email for the discount and my personal email so I can put it on my personal phone.  Once I provided a copy of my invoice which was obviously substantially more than I was expecting to pay and the email address my account was under, radio silence.  I emailed customer service for more times with no response.    I don‚Äôt want this app I don‚Äôt need this app I was misled lead and misscharged    I didn‚Äôt use it and expecte a refund.

Content: i tried using this app for a while but it really took a toll on my mental health. i recommend if you are trying to diet, lose weight, whatever, log what you‚Äôre normal intake is first for a couple of weeks and then slowly start tapering off to a healthy caloric intake. with this app i went from intaking 2500 calories to 1700 calories overnight. this made me feel really bad if i ever went over that 1700 i immediately thought i was a fat piece of s***, so yea...  this app has good workouts, but the cold turkey calorie counter took a toll on my mental health. I‚Äôll probably just go to youtube for workouts anyway

Title: SCAM #772676

Content: First day with this app and am unimpressed.  I like the format but there are some serious fixes needed before it‚Äôll be worth the $30 I paid for the year.  Meals: -It does not save meals, you‚Äôll have to re-enter each meal that is not taken from the app. -The app meals seem to be a random assortment of dishes.  What is a good breakfast, lunch, dinner, or snack?  Need to be better organized. -Bar code scanner has a very limited library & have to enter most foods manually.   -Why are ounces the only available measurement when all our food is in grams?  I have to convert everything I eat.  Since I gave to manually enter most of the food, this slows the process.  Workouts: -The warm ups need to be longer.  They tend to be about 2 minutes of ballistic stretching, then, boom, right into the workout.   -Workouts are about15 to 20 minutes.  Though that can be good if intense enough, these are.  Pick your level & if you‚Äôre in very good shape, do 2.  The app gets an extra star because of the workouts. -Oh, and the sound, there isn‚Äôt any.  If you‚Äôre not looking at your phone you won‚Äôt know when to switch exercises.  A ding, buzzer, voice, something...anything to let you know when to switch.  There are challenges which can focus on abs or diet or other areas which are an extra cost.  Another $10-20 seems odd as I just paid $30 for the app to eat better & exercise.  Now if I want a particular diet or exercise plan I have to pay more?  Foul.  This app has good potential but needs a solid update or two.  Update:   I stopped using the app for a little while & recently restarted.  I regularly use the diet diary which has serious accuracy issues.   Example:  -I ate 1.5 cups of Cheerios (a single serving & 140 calories).   -The app asks only for ounces (1.5 cups = 12 ounces).   -The app calculates 12 ounces as 1276 calories (1 ounce is calculated as 106 calories (should be 12 calories)).   This apparent confusing of ‚Äúounces‚Äù as ‚Äúservings‚Äù is common.  I find I have to fine tune the number of ounces to reflect what I ate (1.4 ounces is calculated as 146 calories).  It‚Äôs a real pain.

Title: Nice concept

Content: This app would be great if it didn‚Äôt have so many problems. I hate all the ads telling me I need to workout more to start. Second, I cannot connect the app on my android to the app on my apple device. On my apple device it signs into the account, but then harasses me saying I have no subscription and I cannot get off of that page. This happens 99 percent of the time and I have to use my smaller android device because I never get that message. It gives me only ONE option for a subscription and will not click out of he message. Third, on certain workouts it freezes at the rest cycle of the workout and it will not save any progress. The app says I am only a few workouts in when I have done A LOT more then what it says.   This app desperately needs to be fixed or I might switch to a competitor that lets me use my apple AND android device to sign in to the same account no problem. Cross platform is one of the first thing app developers should look at.

Title: DONT SUBSCRIBE!

I made it clear that I just wanted to cancel, and they have not responded since. That was almost a week ago now, and my subscription is still not cancelled. I will be very angry if their lack of communication leads to another payment. I really can‚Äôt spare the money right now. It is completely unprofessional, and I hate sounding like a Karen but I was very polite and made it clear that I only had to cancel because of financial trouble, and they have disregarded this and obviously do not care. Awful.   I am seeing several other reviews that say the same exact thing. I am very unsatisfied and angry. This app either needs to be fixed or shut down. You are robbing several people of their money by making it impossible to cancel.  Edit: (522205)

Title: Cannot cancel and no one will answer my questions.

Content: Update: After leaving this bad review someone from the company finally responded to me. In that time I got charged for a third time at the $9.99/ wk subscription. They refunded me for 2 of the 3 charges.  When I signed up through Facebook it said there was a money back guarantee. I am updating my review from 1 to 2 stars solely because I got a partial refund, plus the company asked me to. I still don‚Äôt recommend this app solely because it is almost impossible to get a hold of anyone and it doesn‚Äôt seem like they hold up on refunding your full purchase if you‚Äôre not satisfied.   I found this app through a Facebook advertisement. I liked the quiz they had to ‚Äúbuild‚Äù your own personalized plan. When I completed the quiz it suggested getting their app, which I did, and then paying $9.99 for my plan. There wasn‚Äôt any wording past that about it being weekly or monthly. I figured it was monthly or a one-time thing.  I started using the app and didn‚Äôt feel like it was all that different than other workout apps. The only things that set it apart are the quick access to trainers for questions and the articles. I also like the fasting timer. Aside from that tracking meals is  more difficult than other apps that have a larger data base to pull from. I found I had to manually add a lot of my food.  After having the app for a week I noticed a new $9.99 charge. So I went through their help section to create a ticket to ask why I got charged again. I guess the $9.99 subscription is weekly for ‚Äúmeal plans‚Äù. The recipes looked good for the meal plan but not worth $9.99/wk, which is over $500/yr. That seems a little much for something that is generated through an app. Anyways they responded quickly the first day, which was a Friday and then I didn‚Äôt hear back after 5pm. Which I figured maybe they work 9am-5pm Mon-Fri and I would hear something on Monday.  Today is Monday and I never heard anything back from them. I started a new ticket to try to cancel the membership and if I don‚Äôt hear anything back by tomorrow evening I will be calling Apple to get all my money back. Save yourself the hassle and find a more trustworthy company.  Update for developers: Here are my ticket numbers you have asked for. 494235, 488697 and 479754  Clearly this has been an issue that hasn‚Äôt been resolved and that‚Äôs why I keep contacting the company. Each time I start a new ticket I get an automated response with an ID number and it says I will be contacted within 8 hours by a human. Obviously that hasn‚Äôt happened....

Title: Can I give negative stars??

Content: I wanted to  like this app despite the Most Helpful Reviews ‚Äòwarnings‚Äô I proceeded and signed up for the free trial, and within 30 minutes (literally) I was canceling my free trial to avoid being charged for an app with severely limited functionality. Needless to say the reviews (Most Helpful) are spot on and I agree with them on the noted aspects (severely limited food library, limited serving annotation options, fasting countdown restrictive). As far as the food library is concerned, like a previous reviewer stated, the main unit of measure for food is ounces or grams. This is totally ridiculous, for example I logged in a slice of bread, it was recorded as 28 grams, most ppl eat bread by the slice NOT the gram üò≥. The Fasting feature is a locked function, so if I forgot to ‚Äòstart‚Äô the fast in the app, I‚Äôm stuck with the time that I pressed the button.  The same holds true to extending my fast, occasionally I may extend my fast by an hour or so, unfortunately I can‚Äôt change the time to reflect this.   What I did like about the app: Tips for the Day, Water Tracker( when it worked), Guided Exercise (when it worked).   Now continuing with the Cons: Other areas that I feel needs work are as follows:   The Coach feature: I get having scripted automated responses upon your initial interaction with the app; however I was experiencing some technical issues and reached out to ‚ÄòSupport‚Äô and they recommended that I delete and reload the app. It also informed me that my information would not be lost, as long as I did not attempt a synch prior to the reload. I did as directed and I did not lose my information which was synced with my iWatch; however, I lost all of my meal entries, and my daily Streak days within the app, so I went from 14 days back to Day 1, as of this writing I‚Äôm now back on Day 3. Furthermore to add insult to injury, the ‚Äòinitial‚Äô Coach scripted remarks started all over again! üôÑü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüëé The Coach has also on occasion contradicted itself, in one instant my tip for the day was to have an avocado toast, but in another session it‚Äôs telling me to avoid bread, which one is it?ü§î I also lost my dashboard where the following trackers are no longer available: Workout, Meals, Walk, and Water tracker. Yet I continue to receive notifications to log my meals, and record my workouts, of which I can‚Äôt.  In order to log my meals I would need to ‚Äòpurchase‚Äô this feature üëé. This leads me to believe that you will only have the dashboard options available to you IF you purchase the full version of the app. Not worth the special offer of $29.99 yearly. The dashboard should also offer an option to ‚Äòself-check off‚Äô the tasks for the day, though my daily caloric allowance was 1345 calories doesn‚Äôt mean that I‚Äôm going to necessarily eat that for the day. If I only eat 1200 calories for the day, then the app should allow you to check the radio button denoting that you‚Äôve finished eating for the day. Also if I work out for 15 minutes instead of 30, then so be it and let me close the task out. Recommend that the dashboard features incorporate an edit option.   The Challenges: I signed up for the 21-day sugar free challenge for $10 (plus .81 tax). I figured that I‚Äôve wasted money on lesser things so why not give it a shot. BUT, If you forget to select the ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù or ‚Äúepic fail‚Äù button for the day; you‚Äôre just out of luck as there isn‚Äôt an option to edit this information.    The insidious and unrelenting marketing. I understand that app developers have to earn an income, but can you say ‚Äòoverkill‚Äô. You‚Äôll receive notifications 2-3 times a day offering you a ‚Äògift‚Äô, ‚Äòspecial offer‚Äô ‚Äòchallenge‚Äô or the ‚Äòunread message‚Äô icon will attempt to coheres you into purchasing the full version of the app.   So I must say that I gave it a fair shake (17 days), or according to the app Day 3. Deleting now...
Title: Hey, I tried...üëé

Then a month later I was charged an additional $29.99 for a ‚Äúsubscription‚Äù  that I never signed up for.  I contacted the company and told them that I didn‚Äôt use the app and didn‚Äôt sign up for any subscriptions. I then showed them a screenshot showing in the information for their app out states $29.99 for a 3 month subscription. I told them it had been 1 month, that if they do not refund my money I would report them to the BBB, Paypal and Apple. They said they could give me 1/2 off of what I paid. I told them technically 1/2 off is $29.99 since I was charged twice. They finally refunded me one of the $29.99. They are extremely penny pinching company and dishonest trying to charge people extra.

Title: useless app

Content: I‚Äôve struggled with my weight my entire life. I‚Äôve tried dozens of apps and I‚Äôve stuck to none of them. I decided to try BetterMe after seeing an ad for it on YouTube. I typically do not pay for these types of services bc I have a hard time justifying the money BUT maybe having some skin in the game might make me stick to it, or at least I hope. I bought the $30, 12 week program and so far, I love it. I love that it‚Äôs an all in one weight loss app. Food, weight, exercise and water tracking all right there. What does it for me especially, is the planned workouts. I‚Äôm not very active and have bad knees, so being able to choose walking for my workouts gives me ease of mind. Seeing my workout for the day is a 15 or 20 minute fast walk doesn‚Äôt stress me out, it gets me excited bc I know I can do it and I won‚Äôt be miserable trying to run or do full body workouts that may not be for me. I‚Äôm glad I can take a laid back, simple approach to losing the weight. I also enjoy the workout audio guides. I can listen to my music and it interrupts to tell me when to start speed walking and for how long. Such a simplified way to walk without focusing on it. I‚Äôm really enjoying this app and I‚Äôm hoping in 12 weeks I‚Äôve reached my fitness goal. I would highly recommend this app to anyone looking for a straightforward system to get healthy.

Both times I put vegetarian and specified I do not eat eggs. Tell me why in my meal plan they put eggs! That situation plus the robotic ‚Äútrainer‚Äù made me not even want to explore the app. Pretty sure I spent like 30 dollars on this app. It‚Äôs already not free but then I paid extra for the useless ‚Äútrainer.‚Äù I really should have read the reviews before I purchased this app but I saw it advertised on YouTube and genuinely thought it would motivate me to loose weight.
